review:
[h3] Interesting game with a surprising depth. [/h3]
Gameplay is simple - choose your own adventure. It starts with almost every option leading to death, but after you follow that one thread that allows you to live, you find a fun quest, and can come to a satisfying conclusion.
Art style is unique, maybe not to everyone‚Äôs liking, but I found it appealing.

[spoiler] Oh, ah, ah, ah, ah [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561199485629903', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1709326510}
review:
Its a small little horror point and click game/visual novel. The Story line is interesting, though the end was a little dissapointing for me personally. I would've loved to see the land get bright again or see the future of the farm or something like that, instead of just "Oh, everyone got saved, blackscreen". It was fun to try all possibilities and find out if I die or not. I'm an achievement hunter, so that was fun. The drawing style was really well-fitting for this type of game. 

The only thing that really annoyed me was the situation with the tower. Every time I had to do something outside I had to put in the code again and walk all the way through the caves, etc. Some of the riddles where also too hard for me or didnt make much sense to me, so the Internet had to help me out at least 3 times. My overall playtime was 3 hours which was totally fine for me.

Overall, I really enojed the game and would recommend it anytime. I will definitely buy the second part. Thank you for this masterpiece!

author: {'steamid': '76561198273372473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1709133362}
review:
VN dura pero gratificante, como la vida misma.

Hac√≠a much√≠simos a√±os que no probaba una novela visual, por lo general no me atrae un g√©nero que solo consiste en "leer" y leer y leer m√°s a√∫n. Busco tomar acci√≥n, tener la capacidad de decidir de forma directa y activa; ya tengo mi biblioteca de libros esper√°ndome si quiero sumergirme en gratificantes lecturas. Sin embargo, este juegito en blanco y negro te ofrece la satisfactoria sensaci√≥n de bucear en una historia a la vez que tomas decisiones clave, por lo que se precisa que est√©s muy atento a todo y consideres siempre tus opciones en base a tu inventario y contexto. Eres solo un granjero, no un guerrero de extrema experiencia.

Creo que en parte, el juego resulta adem√°s muy inmersivo por eso mismo. Se sabe de antemano el perfil de jugador que va a terminar probando la obra, haciendo que empatice r√°pidamente con el propio granjero, ambos tienen nula capacidad de lucha, solamente necesitamos intelecto. 

La ambientaci√≥n es sublime cuanto menos, nos alejamos de efectos sonoros abundantes y estridentes para escuchar mera ambientaci√≥n atmosf√©rica, la cual recarga esa idea inmersiva que venimos sintiendo desde el primer momento. Todo tiene un aspecto enfermo, triste y deprimente. No solo eso, sino que al poco de comenzar nuestra traves√≠a advertimos que nos resulta sumamente f√°cil morir. Interactuar con cualquier cosa provoca que invoquemos inmediatamente a la Parca, para llevarnos de este mundo y terminar la partida.
Esto sin duda refuerza la idea deprimente que tanto marca el juego de forma visual, adem√°s de que todo se vea feo y desganado, fallas una y otra y otra vez. Parece que nada te sale bien: tocas algo, te produce una alergia que te mata; te acercas a examinar una cosa, caes en una corriente que te ahoga, etc. ¬øTerminar√° alguna vez esta maldita condena?

Esta idea se repite de manera constante, ya que da igual si sigues avanzando o escoges un camino u otro, termina sucediendo lo mismo. Al final, terminas por guardar partida e interactuar con lo que sea, "total, voy a coleccionar las medallitas estas de logros".

Pero como cit√© al comienzo, todo tiene su recompensa. Consigues un item que te permite alcanzar una cosa que te desbloquea X que te lleva a Y que abre Z...

Si te fijas, se trata de una gigantesca moraleja de vida, una met√°fora en forma de juego. No importa lo mal que lo est√©s pasando, o lo tant√≠simo que te esfuerces por conseguir tus metas; de tus fracasos, llegaran tus victorias, y con ella tu felicidad plena.

Jam√°s te rindas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137798217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1700985474}
review: Fun little game with a simple story and gameplay. Really neat. It can be a little difficult at times, especially by modern standards in puzzle-solving and patience, but it is overall worth the challenge. Achievements are pretty easy to get too. The art-style is really nice as well, all hand-drawn and strongly reminiscent of Alvin Schwartz' work. Highly recommended if you value a good story-driven graphic novel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030940101', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1701376690}
review: I originally got this because it has easy achievements, but WOW. The game is so good. It has you on edge even if you know whats going to happen, all the deaths are worth it and its like the protagonist remembers them each one helping him complete his adventure alive at the end or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320014428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1700288672}
review:
TRY IT! EVEN IF YOU DON'T LIKE POINT-AND-CLICK GAMES, GIVE THIS ONE A TRY!!! IT'S ONLY AN HOUR LONG!

This game is a very simple Point-And-Click Adventure with an incredibly pleasant, simple and short, yet engaging story that is worth experiencing for the singular hour or less it will take you to complete it. I completed the game and all of its achievements just 2 minutes shy of 2 hours and it was a blast going through unlocking them all, because of how funny and humorous they are to unlock. Tried touching shrooms? Here's an achievement for dying. Give this game a try and you will most certainly enjoy, I'm saying that as someone who mainly plays FPS games and was not surprised by the failure that is MW3 2023's campaign so while reviewing my steam library for a few minutes, I decided to actually play through and finish this wonderful experience and I absolutely do not regret skipping 3 hours of sleep to do so. I mean, I am kinda tired still, but this was absolutely worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054216330', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1700164104}
review:
[h1]Vorwort[/h1]

Die Hauptperson steht vor ihrer Farm, die wie der Rest des Landes von einer Seuche befallen ist. Das Land selbst scheint krank zu sein, die Kuh ist tot und allgemein ist die Lage eher zum abgew√∂hnen, also beschlie√üt man, loszuziehen um etwas dagegen zu unternehmen. Und so beginnt ein episches Abenteuer voller Gefahren. Wird der wackere Landwird die Loorbeeren ernten oder sich die Radieschen von unten ansehen?


[h1]Was zu erwarten ist - Ein Wort der Warnung[/h1]

Es gibt kaum Dialoge im Spiel. Stattdessen "wandert" man in diesem [b]Textadventure[/b] durch die Spielwelt, indem man sich von Szene zu Szene klickt. Hier und da sind interessante Orte wie ein verschlossener Schuppen oder ein knorriger Baum, mit denen man (per [b]Multible Choice[/b] Fenster) interagieren kann. Relativ oft ger√§t man in t√∂dliche Situationen. Der [b]grausame Tod[/b] des Spielers wird des √∂fteren mal Thema.


[h1]Funktionsumfang- Quality of Live[/h1]

.Der Funktionsumfang ist nicht all zu gro√ü. Man kann frei Speichern, die Sprache einstellen und einige andere Dinge, die in VNs so √ºblich sind. Ein Inventar oder Tagebuch gibt es nicht. Wer Ged√§chtnisst√ºtzen braucht, greift zu Stift und Pappier oder einem Textdokument.

 
[h1]Zusammenfassung[/h1]

[b]Pro:[/b]
[list]
[*] recht gro√üe Spielwelt zum "erkunden"
[*] viele M√∂glichkeiten, das zeitliche zu segnen
[*] Atmosph√§rische Bleistift-Optik. Passend zum Setting.
[/list]

[b]Kontra:[/b]
[list]
[*] Recht repetitiv, wenn man die Erfolge macht
[/list]


[b]Fazit:[/b]

Disturbed ist ein ziemlich einfaches Textadventure ohne gro√üe Extras, aber die Erkundung und das Ausprobieren von Dingen machen Spa√ü und das ohne einen m√ºden Cent berappen zu m√ºssen, daher kann man hier eigentlich getrost zugreifen

dann folgt doch der [url= https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32139821/}]GermanReviewGroup[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197983056185', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1694277489}
review:
It's a decent little Choose Your Own Adventure-style game with semi-amateurish pencil drawings that gives it a unique look. The puzzles are fairly trivial and could be better designed, but since the game is free it gets a thumbs up. Let's be honest, the real goal of the game is to 100% all the death achievements.

(Random aside: its gameplay reminds me a lot of a barely-known shareware DOS title named Weird Islands from '92)

author: {'steamid': '76561199249083680', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1694047951}
review: If you like horror games and you also like visual novels, then is the game for you. If you are an achievement hunter, this is also a very easy game to 100% all of the achievements in (even the rarest achievement has been completed by over 14% of players at the time of this review). All of this for the price of free, how can you go wrong?

author: {'steamid': '76561198012246112', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1680079696}
review:
[h1] Was nichts kostet, kann doch nur Murks sein? [/h1]

[spoiler] Ts Ts Ts - das ist aber eine sehr oberfl√§chliche Meinung
und trifft hier ABSOLUT NICHT ZU! :-) [/spoiler]

Da sehe ich also diese schlechte, krakelige Bleistiffskizze schwarz in grau auf der Shopseite als Startbild.
Und der zweite Blick verr√§t dann noch: okay, kostet nichts.

Na das wird schon so ein Mist sein, denke ich mir.

Aber gut, f√ºrs Sammeln von "Perfect Games" auf der Steamprofilseite wirds schon reichen.

Alles klar, zackig knackig installiert und gestartet.

Und was soll ich sagen?

[h1]Das Spiel ist eine echte √úberraschung.[/h1]

Die Story, die Locations, die eigenwilligen selbst erstellten Grafiken - wirklich alles hier erinnert mich an meine Kindheit.

Also ich sa√ü nicht in einem verschimmelten Bauernhaus im Weltuntergangsszenario und hab auch nicht Einh√∂rner gejagt oder auch nicht untote Hexen im Keller eingesperrt!

Aber ich habe solche TEXTADVENTURE mit rudiment√§rer grafischer Unterst√ºtzung gespielt und auch programmiert.

[h1]Alles ist hier sch√∂n nachvollziehbar. Keine sinnlosen Plotspr√ºnge oder gar Plotstopper![/h1]

Wo ich fr√ºher mit einem Parser "gehe zu WESTEN, sieh an FRAU IM MINIKLEID AM BAHNHOF, nimm FRAU IM MINIKLEID AM BAHNHOF..." tippte, hab ich hier nun mehrere "what-to-do" Optionen als Men√º. Ist auch gut.

Es gibt mehrere Enden, unz√§hlige Tode, erinnerungsw√ºrdige Momente und AHA-Erlebnisse.

[h1]Sch√∂nes kleines Ding, dass ich damals als kleiner Junge auch gemocht h√§tte - und sogar daf√ºr zahlen w√ºrde.[/h1]

review:
Definitely one of the best free horror games there are! Even though the art may not be the best, it for sure suits everything very well. The game's strongest point is of course the story. Choices do matter and there are quite a lot of unexpected and unpredictable outcomes. Absolutely worth a try, especially if you are into these genres and want easy achievements. 
P.S. The game is also fast to finish! ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198956299818', 'num_games_owned': 2010, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1673142581}
review: This is a VN with a different type of spin on the stories as well as the art. I was unsure whether I would like this game, but I installed it for the fact that it is free to play and it has achievements. The story was funny with a dark sense of humour from the start. You need to complete the game 17 different ways, where most of the paths are quite easy, but the last three achievements take quite long to get. It takes about 50 minutes to complete the game and unlock all the achievements. If you love VN or even just want a few achievements, give this game a try. There is a guide if you get stuck. "Your adventure ends here."

author: {'steamid': '76561198088213112', 'num_games_owned': 1213, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1672230872}
review:
Not sure about this one. I mean, it's free and all that, but the story is incredible generic and boring, overburdened with tons of worn-out trophes, and the navigation becomes a chore. The gameplay ... well, might be a matter of taste, but the only kind of choices you have look like these: Do you want to open the left door (you'll die, at least there're autosaves), the right door (you'll find an item which will be used automatically later on) or the middle door (you'll proceed)? A bit lackluster.
Slightly recommended because it's short and free, and the visuals are okay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115508352', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1668712999}
review: Some of the illustrations are good, some of them are of average quality. It's like a narrative souls-like game because you have to die a lot in order to progress through the game. While the story should have been much better and more effective in this structure, there are only question marks and ambiguity here. You find yourself feeling that there must be more. I know that there is a paid sequel to the game, but if I had hope that I could find answers to the questions in my mind in that game, I would buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998273415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1496702332}
review:
[b]‚äï[/b]Simple, straight-forward, short horror game that hearkens back to the old days of spooky html multiple choice adventure websites. The unique black and white art direction fills the visual world up nicely without robbing you of your own imaginative input. Two endings with plenty of bosses, challenges, and puzzles to get through. This horror game gets bonus points from me for having no cheap thrill jumpscares!

[b]‚äñ[/b]It is a quiet, desolate land, but not in a meaningful way like Dark Souls or Fallout. This universe would have benefited from a little more world-building to fill in the gaps. Back-tracking is a little annoying in this game, and there‚Äôs some instances of death that are downright frustrating.

[b]‚úé[/b]This game was challenging with its sierra-like instant deaths but I successfully got both endings without a guide, and had gotten the better ending first! It feels a bit like a school project, but it‚Äôs a [i]damn good[/i] school project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095643958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1653465386}
review:
what actually draws your eyes and mind to this game? 
the art.

what keeps you clicking on dialog boxes to the next dialog box?
the adventure, the story.

how did you find yourself here looking at a free game?
influenced by others of course...

having seen the entire game played by someone else before my eyes i decided i should also give it a playthrough
not once, not twice.. but three times
1) watch someone else
2) playthrough myself
3) playthrough with patch fixed version for achievements (yes its sad)
-- meaningless trinkets of intangible graphical progress on a thing!

a typical adventure novel style game, you'll face several challenges and mechanics as you learn the correct progression paths - or die trying.

* another game i gathered into my inventory because it supported GNU/Linux

review:
Muy divertido e intrigante, lo jugu√© en 2016 siendo mucho m√°s chico y no pude terminarlo, lo encontr√© hoy de nuevo y me trajo recuerdos de la ambientaci√≥n oscura, me alegra haberle dado una segunda oportunidad, lo pas√© bien y no pude resistirme a conseguir todos los logros. author: {'steamid': '76561198388189772', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1654543800}
review:
Disturbed.
This game was another "Make it for 100% Achievements" game on the list at the beginning for me. I'm not a big fan of horrors, and not also the genre of Visual Novel. That, however, changed in the first few minutes. The story this game offers is absorbing and thrilling. The possible endings with a combination of simple yet dark graphics of the game, with additional sound effects, give the game the variousness and right atmosphere of the story. If you have a spare hour or two and want to try something spooky, I recommend trying this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198430724130', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1653686476}
review:
This is a great little horror game with plenty of deaths to find throughout.
It has a very artistic artstyle that kind of reminds me of a more tranquil Junji Itou story if that makes sense. Only in the visual department though, the story is very medieval dark fantasy where a simple farmer eventually plays the role of hero out of necessity.
The sounddesign works very well to amplify the atmosphere hardly having any music to make you feel alone with most of the sound that is there serving the horror factor.
Overall this is a definite recommend from me, whether you like the horror genre or not. I wouldn't deem it so scary that it will rob you of sleep, but it's very much well worth experiencing as a more relaxed piece for horror enthusiasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102323721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1647497552}
review:
Je n‚Äôaime pas faire √ßa. Pas parce que les gens qui vont me lire vont me ha√Ør, mais parce que je pense au pauvre h√®re, auteur du jeu. Son entreprise a d√ª lui co√ªter bien des heures de travail et il est s√ªrement passionn√© et satisfait par Disturbed. Mais √ßa ne passe pas avec moi. De mon point de vue (je sais que je pr√©cise cela car c‚Äôest ce qui se fait pour se cacher des regards accusateurs), les illustrations ont le niveau de ce qu‚Äôun coll√©gien peut pondre sur une table au fond de la classe de maths durant laquelle ‚Äì fort l√©gitimement ‚Äì il s‚Äôennuie et les illustrations sonores sont, au mieux, de rares sons libres de droits r√©cup√©r√©s dans une base de donn√©es locale. En r√©sum√©, un truc que n‚Äôimporte qui peut accomplir avec un ordinateur connect√©, une palette graphique et le logiciel ad√©quat. L‚Äôauteur de Disturbed ne manque pas de courage, donc. Mais ce n‚Äôest pas cela qui manque aux concepteurs ind√©pendants et ce n‚Äôest pas cela qui fait un bon jeu.
Alors qu‚Äôest-ce qui fait de Disturbed un bon jeu¬†? Rien.
Comme White Night que j‚Äôai abandonn√© aujourd‚Äôhui m√™me (!), Disturbed est une punition. Moche et r√©barbatif, le jeu se veut ¬´¬†inspir√© par la d√©pression et la d√©pendance¬†¬ª (pardon¬†?), inscrit dans la cat√©gorie Horreur (pardon¬†?) et il ne parvient qu‚Äô√† lasser sauf pour l‚Äôinsondable b√™tise qui nous √©treint tous et nous fait poursuivre une qu√™te absurde dans le seul but d‚Äôen conna√Ætre l‚Äôissue¬†! Une issue qui est aussi pr√©visible que la m√©t√©o de la veille, en l‚Äôoccurrence.
Le cheminement ‚Äì puisqu‚Äôil s‚Äôagit d‚Äôune aventure dont vous √™tes le h√©ros (AvH) ‚Äì est coh√©rent, il faudra r√©fl√©chir au moins dix secondes pour surmonter les √©nigmes et, encore une fois, ¬´¬†sauver le monde¬†¬ª, du moins la r√©gion et les terres que notre alter ego cultive, sans oublier sa vache.
J‚Äôai jou√© 39 minutes, c‚Äôest bien suffisant, avant de regarder le [i]walkthrough[/i] en vid√©o. M√™me l√†, je me suis ennuy√©.
Pour conclure sur une note encore plus sombre, je dois dire que la traduction fran√ßaise est‚Ä¶ d√©plorable. Je prie pour que la personne cr√©dit√©e au poste de traduction n‚Äôexiste pas, si c‚Äôest le cas je reste p√©trifi√© par la surprise et l‚Äôeffroi. Mais, je pense que le jeu est traduit via internet puisque la page du magasin est √©galement traduite (pour la part qui revient au studio) avec les coudes.
Cela dit, ce n‚Äôest pas extr√™mement pire que l‚Äôanglais utilis√© qui est factuel, sans vie, sans odeur, tout ce qui fait une mauvaise AvH.
Bref, je ne peux pas recommander un truc pareil sous le seul pr√©texte que c‚Äôest un jeu gratuit, ce n‚Äôest pas un argument. Non, ceci n‚Äôest pas un jeu, c‚Äôest le r√©sultat de dizaines d‚Äôheures pass√©es sur une palette graphique et √† bidouiller un logiciel en open source. Au mieux.
Je conseillerais aux gens derri√®re Disturbed de trouver de meilleurs moyens d‚Äôoccuper leur temps‚Ä¶

- - - [Official Review] - - -
This is my second review on a game I went into knowing it would be a fairly easy process to get all the achievement's. For the sake of the review, I played my first play through with absolutely no guide and then used one for any remaining achievement's (which was only 3). It became very clear early on that this game was almost like a dying simulator. Almost every next choice you make leads to your death and then it's time to spam your mouse to catch up to where you were to fix your mistake. (This is where you should know to abuse the save feature on this game) Once you realize the goal of the game after multiple death's, it becomes fairly easy to understand what needs to be done to get to the ending of Disturbed. Overall, I wasn't very impressed by the story-line, wasn't anything to write home about, but also wasn't absolutely terrible. With the use of the drawing's for all the visual's and how they randomly pop up on your screen can be unsettling and admittedly had the hair on my arm's stand up at certain points, but nothing that terrifies you. Overall, Disturbed is a below average game that can feel a bit like a chore to figure out and needs a bit more depth added to it other than just dying over and over to figure out how to proceed through the game. Disturbed lands a 2/5 on my rating scale and can tell you that I won't blame you if you decide to avoid playing this game.. but hey, it is free!

author: {'steamid': '76561198102416964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1642989091}
review: A fairly simple and short text adventure, but the art style is nice and I found myself enjoying the experience overall. Plus, it's free

author: {'steamid': '76561198154430682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1478841354}
review: This is a well made, linearly structured, point-and-click adventure game that is very atmospheric due to the morbid nature of the illustrations and the unpredictability of death in this adventure. The illustrations have this scratchy, amateurish style to them which at first looks a bit cheap, but the further you play, the more you realize the hidden scare factor at play; it feels off putting at first, but becomes a bit more intimidating when death greets you, because the death scenes have a far more refined quality to them with the line work looking far more confident, committal and sharp, so the amateurish style of drawing is misleading and helps play into the tension this world creates. On top of that, due to its monotone palette and use of fog, it helps create this sort of eerie dissonance exploring the world this game is set in. the only thing I find that truly holds the art back is the lack of hard values (shadows) to communicate dim areas, there are is some of that, but too much of it is preoccupied by light values. I didn't touch this in my review of the sequel, but there is a real sharp contrast between the art styles with one being more refined whilst still keeping in the same amateurish feeling in its execution as well as being faithful to the original. I didn't touch on game play here because it is really just about making all of the right decision to make it to the end, and if you made a couple of extra good decision, you basically just get a better ending, so there isn't much in that department to talk about. Overall, this is a pretty good game to pick up, and if you liked it, make sure to drop a dollar for the dev, they truly deserved it.

review: A short story that takes a shot at horror and fantasy in a short narrative choose-your-path adventure. The setting is eerie and the music is soothing and unsettling. Great game and a worthwhile play(which is why some youtubers are used for the trailer of this game) and would love to see more creations from the author. On a separate note, according to the guides on achievements, the system does not work, so if you are achievement hunting, this game may not help you.

review:
Rather straightforward choose your own adventure/path game, with 99% of them leading straight into your death. It has a eery atmosphere and cool black&white artwork. 

The random dying part may be frustrating at first, but you it's easy to embrace it thanks to the quicksave feature so you are never forced to replay parts you don't want to. Definitely worth a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316646048', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1612310714}
review:
[b]To be completely honest I came here for the achievements and ended up discovering a gem of a visual novel![/b]

You play as a farmer exploring the blight ridden world around them, and there are multiple endings depending on whether you're feeling curious, want to give up or want to make the world better. 

Even though it's a short plot, the amount of endings you have means there is a fair bit of replay value for a free visual novel. The illustrations are simple and monotone but have a certain creepy aesthetic to them which carries the spookiness of the plot through to the end. There is actually a small level of complexity to it compared to other F2P visual novels I've played so this isn't a constant 'click to get to the end' story! There is no overwhelming soundtrack that takes away from the plot either, and the sound effects aren't loud or jumpscare-ish. 

All in all, it's free and worth the playtime. As this seemed okay I will most likely buy the paid one when I have the time to play a larger visual novel. 

Note for achievement hunters: [spoiler]about 3/4 of them are easy and the last few take a bit of time. All in all about an hours worth of your time if you read it all as well. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561199083554942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1604246359}
review:
Another "choose your own adventure" style horror game, Disturbed stands out because of its stark black and white, creepy sketchbook style of art.  As cliched as it sounds, the style reminds me a bit of the Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark books, which is what drew me to this in the first place.

The game itself is more brutal than the aforementioned adventure books, because literally one wrong choice can end in death, and it's not always immediately obvious how that choice could be the bad one.  Something as simple as taking a nap in the wrong place can kill you.  The writing is very well done and descriptive, and I never felt like the author was being intentionally deceptive.  There were actually a few points where they subtly warn you about making a terrible mistake before you inevitably do the thing anyway because save states exist, so why not?

The world of Disturbed is scary but familiar, and with touches of fantasy to balance out the macabre, there are worse ways to spend a few hours trying to find all of the possible endings and deaths (which, coincidentally, are how you get all of the achievements).

author: {'steamid': '76561198332843218', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1710567924}
review:
This was one of the first games I downloaded to steam because I bought a very large game that took forever to download. So I got this just messing around with stuff. Generic crap like clickers, and I got this cause it was a small file size and the art looked weird.

Imo this is my fav free visual novel game on steam
Its awesome, it has multiple choices, different endings, multiple outcomes, puzzles, exploration, all kinds of stuff. It also has an awesome atmosphere. This is imo what visual novels are about and the creator blackpen is a very nice artist with some real creative and macabre talent. Lot of visual novels on steam are garbage.. This ones smart, open ended, fun, and creative. It should get more praise than it does but for some reason most gamers prefer trash and overlook a wonderfully creative game like this.

If you like classics like myst or riven, then you will enjoy this.. Its not an automatic visual novel with easy triggers however. You will be tested and you can either figure them out through trial and error or from a guide. But I messed around with it a lot until i couldn't guess anymore before I ever looked up any guides, and I suggest you play it without a guide as well, least for a while. You will be more surprised by the outcomes that way. Its also an atmosphere/art game, and is a little depressing given the nature of whats going on in the game. But its not totally devoid of hope as you can survive, just don't expect it to be easy.

Best free visual novel on steam imo and I've yet to play one as good. And please don't recommend any garbage suicide otaku crap to me, that stuff is saturated trash. We need more visual novels like this, with actual creepy western art and mature adult themes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107635920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1603568745}
review: Hm i was very interested at the start, but when i searched every single part of this game, read all things and tried all death, a fucking ghost killed me. I couldn't go any other way, the only way i could was death. Also this game has a lot of puzzles, but i found only knife, rope and a flower. Knife served me once, rope and flower i didn't have a chance to use, cus ghost killed me. I don't think that replay all the dungeon will not kill me again. So basically i didn't have the opportunity to try 2 items to do something. Also i read what to do with all the puzzles (in diaries and books) but i didn't find any item to solve them. Feels like a person give me a good book and took it away from me before i could end it. Lame.

review:
hi, i hate this game, it's a great puzzle-point-and-click adventure, i hate how i always end up dying, the drawings are awesome, frigg i  forgot again which friggin way i should take, the story is great and interesting.. at least the bits i know and well probably also the bits i don't know (especially the ones i don't yet know!), i hate the spider and the ghost i want to touch this dangin stone, shift i died again - you should too!
enjoy your inability to maintain track of your decisions after a hard day at work or a nice day at a park or cheat and take notes - i haven't yet but maybe will, cause .. well.. WHICH WAY DID I COME FROM AGAIN..oh i'm running around in circles.. excuse me. 
play it, enjoy it, kill off your character in various scenarios, yay!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082396844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1601776575}
review:
I wanted to press on the "recommended" button, because it is okay for a free game, but then i decided not to take that into consideration and make a review based on what this game actually deserves.
It seems interesting at first, but then it just turns into a random death simulator. It would have been alright if those deaths were smart and had some subtle clues to look for, trying to find the way that doesn't kill you. It has some that you can figure out by using your brain, not going to take that away from it, but most of them are just like "Oh, you want to go this way? Aight, you're dead". It gets on your nerves after some time, or at least it did for me. I was relatively close to the end, since I got 14/17 achievements, then I got to a point where I only had two choices and both of them would kill me, so I just said f it and watched someone on YouTube finish it. 
The visuals are pretty nice, but they could have worked a little bit more on the atmosphere, at least some fitting music would have been amazing for keeping the player immersed in the game. 
It doesn't really have a story that keeps you interested, it barely connects any dots and the ending is...meh, it just leaves you with that feeling of "Was that it?".
I would still say that some may find it fun, so since it is free, I would encourage you to play it, if you are bored and want to spend like an hour of your life somehow, but don't go in with high expectations.

review: Would not recommend if you're looking for a horror game. This is more of a fantasy story with some disturbing visuals, focused rather on puzzles than scares. If you don't mind that, absolutely go play Disturbed! Finding the various endings is a lot of fun and the large number of save slots allows you to try out different paths without big consequences.

review:
Gra przygodowa z elementami visual noveli utrzymana w klimacie dark fantasy. 
Pokierujemy losami prostego farmera kt√≥rego gospodarstwo zaczƒô≈Ço podupadaƒá przez nƒôkajƒÖcƒÖ krainƒô plagƒô.
Grafika w Disturbed zosta≈Ça narysowana rƒôcznie i jest pozbawiona jakichkolwiek kolor√≥w, wszystko ma formƒô brudnego czarno-bia≈Çego szkicu.

Podczas eksploracji mo≈ºemy znale≈∫ƒá przedmioty kt√≥re pomogƒÖ nam w p√≥≈∫niejszej wƒôdr√≥wce jak np. miecz do obrony przed agresywnƒÖ miƒôso≈ºernƒÖ rybƒÖ czy lina kt√≥rƒÖ mo≈ºemy wykorzystaƒá podczas schodzenia w g≈ÇƒÖb starej studni. R√≥wnie kluczowym elementem rozgrywki jest umieranie. Zako≈Ñczyƒá ≈ºycie mo≈ºemy na wiele r√≥≈ºnych sposob√≥w (wiƒôkszo≈õƒá osiƒÖgniƒôƒá dostajemy w≈Ça≈õnie za giniƒôcie w okre≈õlony spos√≥b). A to po wej≈õciu do jaskini zagryzie nas nied≈∫wied≈∫ a to umrzemy we ≈õnie, a to schrupie nas na ≈õniadanie wielki pajƒÖk itd. ≈ÅƒÖcznie mo≈ºemy w Disturbed zginƒÖƒá a≈º na 15 sposob√≥w dlatego warto czƒôsto zapisywaƒá grƒô. 
Bardzo ale to bardzo spodoba≈Ç mi siƒô klimat gry. Realia dark fantasy sƒÖ naprawdƒô dark. OtaczajƒÖcy nas ≈õwiat jest pozbawiony kolor√≥w, ponury przyt≈ÇaczajƒÖcy, depresyjny do tego na ka≈ºdym kroku czyha ≈õmierƒá. GrajƒÖc mo≈ºemy wrƒôcz do≈õwiadczyƒá uczucia beznadziei i zaszczucia. author: {'steamid': '76561198124661133', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1594548751}
review:
An atmospheric free horror point and click game, although it's just choices you click, not where to go on your screen. Pretty gloomy mood, this game, and it's very hard not to die or find your way to complete this game without ploughing through it while making notes, or using a guide eventually, like I ended up doing.

Disturbed probably won't change your mind about point and click games if you don't like them, but for a little over an hour of playtime, I thought there was enough here to warrant a playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993399650', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1608060685}
review: This is a throwback to the old text adventure games, like Death Gate.  What you're getting here is a series of static images, and when you click on the scene you are given a series of choices "Go Left, Go Right, Open the Chest, Open the left door", that kind of stuff.  On most occasions your choices require no thought behind them, the outcomes are all trial and error based.  Basically, save upon entering a scene, click all the options to see which one kills you and which one helps you advance.  30 years ago this may have been awesome, but today...no.  The hand drawn art is cool and the music is spooky, but with so many better games to play, it was a struggle to finish this one.  It's free, so give it a try...just keep those expectations low.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184897393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 653, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1592010203}
review:
I enjoyed the adventure, the exploration, and the multitude of deaths (made more tolerable by the numerous manual save slots and the death related achievements.  I liked the art and overall minimalistic sounds and scenery. 

Each scene/location provides 2-5 choices from which the game branches.  I think this game is the perfect size ‚Äì smaller would have felt too little and larger could have easily resulted in getting lost.  [i]Disturbed: Beyond Aramor [/i]looks interesting, though probably more frustrating on account of its larger size.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134575412', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1591238765}
review: For a free horror game i can honestly say this one was quite a fun experience.  You can get about half the achievements without using a guide like i did just clicking a bunch of routes, but honestly i had to use the guide to gain 100% which is what I was aiming for because i was struggling after 35min to finish the last 4.  Im sure if i would have spent 10 hours doing every aspect of the game options,  it probably would just come to you.   I rate this game 8/10 for a casual story type horror game and hope others spend more time than i did on it and experience the full game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046742781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1590697887}
review:
A fun little time.  It's a fairly short game, which is good considering how hard it is not to die.  The story ends a little abruptly but it ends with a note of hope which is a good way to wrap up a fairly bleak adventure.  The music and sound cues are fairly subtle, which works with the art quite well.

I don't think it's something with a lot of replay value, but I enjoyed announcing 'I died' every time it happened and will probably come back eventually to get the last two achievements I missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561199014866464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1590652185}
review:
This is like a visual novel without the moe characters, and a lot of things will kill you. The art and writing are simplistic, but very good. I really liked this games unusual design style. The challenge is there, and it's actually really clever. One clue is so subtle but so good that I felt really stupid for not seeing it! Actually creates a great sense of atmosphere, and the world the story is set in is really cool and really dark.

Nice fun casual game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118213076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1484963266}
review: Disturbed es una novela visual de aventura y puzzles con escenarios terror√≠ficos dibujados a mano y si bien no son muy detallados logra conseguir una atmosfera depresiva. Somos un granjero llamado Von que despierta en un mundo lleno de oscuridad y sin esperanzas, debemos embarcarnos en la aventura y descubrir c√≥mo cambiar esta situaci√≥n. Es un juego corto pero gratuito que sinceramente jugu√© por los logros y est√° parte me pareci√≥ un poco tediosa porque si quieres desbloquearlos todos debes acceder a todos los caminos que mayormente te llevan a la muerte.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966174472', 'num_games_owned': 1146, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1587941730}
review:
Muermo no, lo siguiente, con premisas como "Crea tu propia aventura" o "las elecciones importan" me la han intentado colar pero no han podido, nos encontramos ante un juego para textualmente, perder el tiempo. Disturbed es un juego harto lineal que posee pues, una historia muy forzada y sesgada, pillada con pinzas, solo tiene desencadenantes y no una historia como tal en donde los logros los vas consiguiendo cada vez que haces las cosas "mal", b√°sicamente, mueres, y que no puedes saltarte los pasos, me refiero, para conseguir algo siempre tienes que conseguir el paso anterior, eso s√≠, se te lo saltaste, vas tener que retroceder por 20 escenarios para hacer un mero tramite, y para colmo, cada vez que mueres, el juego se reinicia hasta haber nacido de nuevo y tienes que volver a seleccionar hasta el idioma, lo raro es que no se haya desinstalado de lo p√©simo que es. Me ha parecido muy aburrido, no se ni lo que he pagado por este juego pero seguro que fue demasiado, aunque fueran un par de c√©ntimos.

Mi recomendaci√≥n, si lo encuentras gratuito o quieres llenar tu vitrina de otro juego polvoriento al que no jugaras o que lo pasar√°s solo por los logros, este es tu juego. Si no, hay opciones mucho mejores en el cat√°logo de Steam en este mismo formato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080291518', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1587476968}
review:
Oui, pour les amateurs de jeux narratifs type livre dont vous √™tes le  h√©ros, qui r√™vent d'un jeu ou il faut savegarder √† tous les tableaux, et qui  aiment les succ√®s constitu√©s des diff√©rentes morts qui arrivent au protagoniste. 

Le jeu est plus une aventure narrative qu'un jeu. Il est dans la lign√©e des textuals games des ann√©es 80 ou c'√©tait les lignes de texte qui faisaient vibrer nos ptis coeurs en mousse.  Les graphismes sont chouettes. 

MAIS. 

C'est chiant. On passe son temps √† recommencer, se perdre, ne pas comprendre la logique et les interactions sont... euh... bah... pas l√†. 
Le perso n'a pas de stuff, ne peux pas s'en procurer, et c'est toute la diff√©rence avec un jeu d'aventure. 
Le c√¥t√© " exploration des aspects sombre de l'angoisse et de la d√©pression" euh, je le cherche encore. On croise une licorne, un ours, un chariot, un... bref. 

Il est gratuit, testez le, c'est une exp√©rience, et c'est possiblement plaisant pour certains, et c'est pour √ßa que je ne le recommande pas pas ( krkrkr) mais franchement, je pense qu'il existe des exp√©riences similaires tr√®s largements sup√©rieures. 

La traduction fran√ßaise est passable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268400506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1586848979}
review:
Really fun and interesting visual novel. 17 different endings and most of them are pretty funny/morbid. There is a supernatural plague at force in the game and it's your job to figure out how to stop it. It's ominous, but nothing terrifying; anyone over 10 could handle the subject matter. The deaths in game aren't explicitly shown and usually have a funny caption along with them. It goes to show the game doesn't take itself too seriously in the horror department, which makes it fun to play casually. 
Disturbed is a neat short story here with a lot of thought into all the possible paths a person could take. The hand drawn scenes are awesome, the music in the game is nice, and its FREE! You just can't beat that. Took me about an hour and ten minutes to 100% the achievements. Absolutely worth checking out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007787000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1585438904}
review:
Death is lurking every corner, every page, every click... and all left to you is... guessing.

I seen it a billion times before. It is basically a linear story masked as if a branching-story by giving player some options to click. There are only three possible results: Continue the story (the only plot avaiable, actually), have something pointless (contributing very little to the mood and giving the player absolutely no information about the game, setting, story or whatever) or just... die. Nice way of solving the problem of adding options for the player click on.

The Interactive Fiction community is full of it. There is a lot of wonderful programmers or talented designers who wants making a game. However, they use lacking the skill of a story teller. This is the resul. You end with a fake interactive fiction poorly delivering a story, where the real game is just taking notes and map where to click to not die.

Even the Horror theme wents melting down in this mess. First, because it is over-used, as a "scary pictures" pops-up all the time. Second, because there is no narrative line long and deep enough to build up tension. 

Character is vague, reasons are vague, objectives are vague. A vague game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317860023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1585262257}
review: What a fun game. This 100% choose your own adventure like the old school books. Yes, you have to back track, A LOT. But there are things you can actually just figure out so I felt the balance was enough to keep me going. Illustrations were nicely dim, I liked the kind of animation that was bordering on goofy but it just continued the vibe. Music and sound effects were appropriately sparing. Had legitimate "yay!", "aww, man", "take that!" throughout. This is a very fun game. If you're looking for nonstop guns blazing high graphics just go away now. Or try it, you just might like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418261627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1584956881}
review:
[h1]¬°No dejes que mi sacrificio sea en vano! [/h1]

[i]Este tipo de juegos de horror en los que tienes que tomar decisiones me encantan. "Disturbed" no fue la excepci√≥n, tiene una historia simple pero entretenida, te genera esa sensaci√≥n de no querer parar hasta exprimirle todo el jugo. 
El juego tiene 2 finales, uno "malo" y otro bueno, personalmente me gust√≥ m√°s el malo, porque los finales agridulces me pueden.
Les recomiendo que guarden todo el tiempo, para que les sea m√°s f√°cil conseguir todos los logros o en caso de que mueran (que van a ser bastantes veces), no tener que empezar desde un punto muy alejado al que se quedaron.

La √∫nica cr√≠tica negativa que voy a dar y que espero que arreglen, es que el idioma no se matiene fijo. Cada vez que sales a la pantalla de inicio, o cargas un nueva partida despu√©s de morir, el idioma vuelve a ponerse en ingles. Y la verdad es un poco molesto tener que estar modificando el idioma una y otra vez. Lleg√≥ un punto que me cans√© y lo dej√© en ingles, total puedo entenderlo perfecto. Pero estar√≠a bueno que arreglaran ese detallito.

 Si estas aburrido y quieres algo corto pero atrapante, este juego es perfecto para ti.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561199021671491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1647990650}

review: Let me say something right now. Unless you wanna spend at least over 15 hours in this game completing it to the fullest with the achievements, it's best to get a guide, especially for the last two achievements, because they're craaaaaazy long. This is basically a trial and error game where you are going on a ton of adventures. The graphics are pretty cool, there is just not thaaaat much action, it's more of a visual novel game more than anything. Great game to get achievements for freeeeee.

author: {'steamid': '76561198423467246', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1582929281}
review: Bei Disturbed handelt es sich um eine tolle kleine Mischung aus Visual Novel und Point & Click Adventure. An jedem Ort wird man gefragt, ob man beispielsweise den linken oder rechten Weg einschlagen m√∂chte. Manchmal gibt es auch etwas zu entdecken und man erh√§lt dabei wichtige Gegenst√§nde, um die Geschichte voranzutreiben. Generell trifft man somit kontinuierlich Entscheidungen. Die meisten davon f√ºhren allerdings zu einem sofortigen und am√ºsanten Tod. Aufgrund dieser zahlreichen Sackgassen ist die eigentliche Handlung, welche man bis zum Ende spielen kann, sehr linear. Es gilt also herauszufinden, welcher Weg der richtige ist und in welcher Reihenfolge man irgendwann die Orte besuchen muss. Nichtsdestotrotz existieren zwei unterschiedliche Enden, die man erreichen kann. Die Handlung mag zwar belanglos sein, doch dank des Spielprinzips hatte ich viel Spa√ü mit Disturbed. Die dazugeh√∂rigen Bilder und die Musik waren sehr schlicht, aber ohne Zweifel stimmig. F√ºr Zwischendurch einfach perfekt!

review:
I recommend it for the art, mood, and huge choice. 

But the game doesn't follow logic - there's really only 2 ways to win, and the choices you make to get there you probably wouldn't be able to figure out yourself. A lot of going back and forth and doing the opposite of what you think you should do.

Love the death scenes though. Do read the story. 

6/10

review:
It's a cool point-and-click with a spooky atmosphere. I'd argue that the story is bland and generic, but hey, the game is free so you can't really criticize it too harshly. It was made using RPG maker or something like that, and it's a very creative use of a game engine in my opinion. It's a quite cool game, it's free, and if you're often bored like me I'd recommend you this to check out when you're bored. 

[b] 4.1/10 [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198040954651', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1579451297}
review:
I've seen this game described as being like the "Choose your own adventure" novels I remember from my childhood.  I have also seen it described as the Dark Souls of visual novels.  Both of these descriptions are pretty accurate.

You play as a farmer who wakes up to a dystopian medieval nightmare; a world where anything and everything will kill you in the blink of an eye.  And it does.  Repeatedly.
Despite this, I never found myself getting frustrated with having to restart the game and work my way back through it (the save feature is for wimps!).  The story was intriguing enough that I found myself focusing on resolving it, rather than screaming "BS" at my screen every time I died.

Definitely worth a play if masochism is your thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976452525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1572417816}
review:
If this review were anything like the game, you would have died four times before the end of this sentence.

It's not as bad as it sounds, though.  In fact, it helps set the perfect mood at the beginning.  This thing opens in a really dark place.  You're a nameless farmer whose entire world is decaying around him, body and soul, through the poisonous attack of some mysterious dark pestilence.  So like a boss he decides to go do something about it.

That little description doesn't do justice to the surprising vividness with which it's portrayed.  I'm not kidding.  This blighted world practically seeps right out of your screen in a cloud of noxious vapor.

The minimalist black-and-white drawings might not look like much at first glance, but add some nice lighting and fog, ominous music and crisp sound effects and they really come to life.  They remind me of this book of horror stories that everybody had when we were kids.  You know, that one with the picture of the corpse woman that scared the hell out of every child in America.

The game itself is sort of a hybrid.  Not really a point-and-click, even though you do interact with objects and solve a few little puzzles; and despite being driven mostly by text-based decisions it's not quite a choose-your-own-adventure either, since there's a good bit of non-linear exploration to be done.
  
What really stood out, though--and I wasn't expecting this at all--was the emotional arc that the game follows.
  
To say that you start off in pretty dire straits is an understatement.  They sketch a portrait of a thoroughly beaten man who's about T-minus half a day from just lying down in weary defeat and withering away to dust with everything else.  The writing here is simple but its flat, gray tone is very effective in conveying a state of mind beyond even desperation, to the point where you can feel real despair.  It's kind of scary, in fact; and in a game with no other living people to defeat or save that actually created a surprising amount of motivation all on its own.
  
Maybe it's divine intervention, or maybe he summons the will to fight from some last, hidden well of inner strength; but he takes a step, and then another.  And as the player at first it all seems futile; everywhere you turn you find only death.  At some point, though, you see a little success and it sparks a glimmer of hope.  Before you know it you settle into an adventure which carries you through to the end.  When you finally triumph, you feel a sense not only of victory, but almost of purification, like you clawed you way out the vilest swamp imaginable into the sunlight of a spring morning.

That's how it felt to me, at least.  Pretty compelling stuff.

As epilogue to all this, I finally read the whole store descripion after finishing it.  The author claims it was "inspired by experiences of depression and addiction," and I believe him.  It definitely carries a certain weight that seems to propel it beyond mere plot into the realm of allegory.

Maybe I should have known that ahead of time, but what can I say. When I see "free" it's download first and ask questions later. 



You can find more indie game reviews at [url=https://oddlittlegames.com] oddlittlegames.com [/url] or visit my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34514756/] curator page. [/url]  Thanks, and enjoy!

review:
[h1]Disturbed[/h1]


Muy buen juego, aventura interesante y ademas es gratis. No me suelen gustar mucho las "novelas visuales", pero este me llamo la atenci√≥n en cuanto lo mire, aparte de que es de terror. Somos un granjero (si no mal recuerdo) en el cual debemos tomar decisiones y buenos caminos para sobrevivir y averiguar que demonios esta pasando, lo que esta chido del juego, es que debes escoger bien tus decisiones, porque puedes morir de distintas formas y tiene finales alternativos. Esta bien el juego, digo para matar el tiempo jugandolo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061364654', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1572653019}
review:
I downloaded and completed Disturbed to support the developer's goal of raising awareness about depression and mental illness.  

It is a simply constructed narrative, but effective at conveying the difficulty of overcoming dark moods, depression and feelings of hopelessness.  There are lots of ways to die quickly, and only one correct path.  1 to 2 hours of simple, linear puzzling for completion.

The gameplay is nothing new or groundbreaking, but the art is stylish, appropriate and hand-drawn. The developer is to be commended for tackling a difficult emotional theme, and for publishing the game for free as a public service.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032487588', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1566922351}
review:
Disturbed is a casual, exploratory, and atmospheric game that is worth your time.  Of course, no cost.  It's essentially linear and text based.  There are no jump scares.  The strategy is largely built on fetch quests, which I personally enjoy, if taken in moderation.  No Steam cards.  No dexterity required.  

1. GRAPHICS: The b/w graphics on the Steam Store page are representative.  If you're looking for eye candy, look elsewhere.  Personally, I kinda liked it.   The graphics complemented the atmosphere.

2. ACHIEVEMENTS: Some have complained that the 17 achievements are mostly death related. However, I would consider the achievements a "reward" for your death, a way that compensates you for a failed strategy.  That encourages exploration and trial/error. 

3. REPLAY VALUE: Absolutely none -- because in playing the game, you learn the choices.  Now that I've finished, I plan to uninstall it.   It's a great one-and-done for probably one 1-2 hour session.

4. FINAL COMMENTS: Save, save, save.  -- but DON'T use the autosave.  Note that making progress in one area before another area may prevent either getting a death achievement (in other words, correctly acquiring an appropriate object will ensure that you survive/succeed).  Plus, you won't experience the alternative ending.  There are more save slots that you can populate.  --  Don't you want to backtrack just a little rather than start the whole game over?

author: {'steamid': '76561198127191921', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1561821005}
review:
First of all, what I liked about the game is that it reminds me of the Choose Your Own Adventure series of books I read a few years ago. Each action could lead you to your death which puts you back to the beginning to continue another adventure. The game is in a fantasy world where a plague is destroying the land, you are a farmer who is going to save the land. The game is dark, and the pictures are drawn black and white in creepy yet beautiful sketches which reflects on the dark themes of the game. I like the multiple endings which some I had to look up a guide, the easy achievements which every ending gives. 

If you ever read and loved the Choose Your Own Adventure books when you were younger, like visual novels, dark atmospheres, short games, and easy achievements. This game is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078463024', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1558780485}
review:
It's pretty good, for a free choose your own adventure.
The graphics, or still images rather, are charming in their own way. Don't expect to see minutely detailed full colour sets, but don't expect a quick MS paint job either. A somewhat repetative kind of CYOA, but then that's the beauty of these games I think, each time you die you learn a little more and progress further next time. 
Worth a couple of plays, it's free so you've nothing to lose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102136663', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1561360327}
review:
A Choose Your Own Adventure game in a rather bleak setting. The atmosphere and mood are represented well by the art and the fact that basically everything can kill you.

There isn't much music, but especially the main menu theme is very interesting. The longer you listen to it, the more it changes, with the occasional seemingly random (yet somehow not discordant) note finding its way into the melody. I'm pointing this out because it caught my attention only when I tabbed out of the main menu and had it playing in the background; otherwise I wouldn't have noticed since there's not much reason to sit in a main menu for longer than it takes to click somewhere.

That aside, it's a good little game/adventure/VN/whatever you want to call it. The art is kind of rough which fits with the themes of it. There's a surprising amount of choices to make, and a somewhat surprising amount of deaths; you definitely have to play through different paths and figure out how to reach the endings that don't kill you, especially because some actions require items which you will find later.
I'll be honest, I used a guide after getting killed a few times, but I'm lazy, and it's possible to figure all these things out through observation and persistence - though this also involves quite a bit of back and forth in some cases which is less appealing.
Often times I also got killed by making decisions I [i]knew[/i] would get me killed, just to see how it would go down.

The story itself isn't particularly special, but there are some surprises. The frequent deaths didn't feel frustrating to me and even in case one forgets to save the game, it doesn't take long to get back to basically anywhere.

"Free" doesn't always deserve a recommendation, but in this case it does.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1560705181}
review:
Disturbed est un genre de livre dont vous √™tes le h√©ros illustr√© en crayonn√© gris avec une ambiance r√©ussie, qui nous propose une histoire de d√©solation avec plein de morts possibles. L'int√©r√™t est d'explorer ces fa√ßons de mourir jusqu'√† trouver la lumi√®re au bout de ce p√©riple bien sombre. Au d√©but j'√©tais un peu r√©ticent, c'√©tait style mort directe sur le mauvais choix et ce choix √©tait assez √©vident. Heureusement, pass√© le premier tiers, on arrive dans une zone o√π les choix sont plus subtils et on peut faire pas mal de chose avant de mourir sans forc√®ment l'avoir vu venir. Je suis content de m'√™tre accroch√©.

Le truc p√©nible, le jeu se remettait en anglais √† chaque rechargement. Bien lourd pour un jeu dont le principe est de mourir toute les 30 secondes si comme moi, on veut tout voir. Pas compris comment rester durablement en fran√ßais et au vu du forum, je ne suis pas le seul. Du coup j'en ai eu marre et je l'ai fait en anglais.

Presque 2h sur une histoire qui se bonifie en avan√ßant, malgr√© ce souci de VF volatile, j'en garderai le souvenir d'un bon petit gratuit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024806132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1560578163}
review:
"despair" would probably be a better title. The deaths in this adventure game are so frequent that the beginning feels claustrophobic.

Yes the deaths are deserved in a way, but I like the feeling of options. I also really enjoy not having 20 clicks before any meaningful decision is made, meaning each death results in tedium and a stretched memory.

Neat idea and atmosphere though. Art can't hold up to it. But its a neat idea.

This may seem ungrateful because its free, but even if its free, why would you play something just to get bored and frustrated?

author: {'steamid': '76561197972330729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 362, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1556466714}
review: A very good choose your own adventure in the classic style, in which there are few correct choices and many, many deaths. Efficient text and easy loading/saving make it painless and entertaining to explore all the grisly outcomes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198517386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1560071924}
review:
Disturbed is a short, text-driven adventure set in a desolate world stricken by a blight of unknown origin. You begin on your farm, seeing your crops die around you. You have two choices: wallow in despair or eliminate the despair spread across the entire land.

This game is definitely worth checking out. It's short and it doesn't take a whole lot of space on your computer. Give it a shot. You won't regret it.

review: Disturbed est une petite histoire visuelle se d√©roulant dans un moyen-√¢ge ravag√© par un fl√©au, avec quelques touches de surnaturel et d‚Äôhorreur. L‚Äôambiance du jeu, l√©g√®rement angoissante, est renforc√©e par des sons travaill√©s ainsi que par de beaux graphismes, faits √† la main avec un style crayon √† papier. Le sc√©nario, plut√¥t classique, est plaisant √† suivre, avec des choix √† faire permettant soit de progresser, soit de tr√©passer. Disponible en fran√ßais via les options, le jeu se remet en anglais √† chaque nouvelle partie, contrairement au reste des options qui ne se r√©initialise pas. Concernant la dur√©e de vie, le jeu est court (environ une heure pour le terminer √† 100%) et plut√¥t facile. A noter enfin que Disturbed est un jeu gratuit, et qu‚Äôil est possible de soutenir son d√©veloppeur via l‚Äôachat du DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056888486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1557279599}
review:
This is an ok game all in all, but i just don't feel the ''Chill'' down my spine, i (personally) feel like all the deaths is too predictable, as well as the fact that you die from basically everything.

I know i didn't play much, but there wasn't much in the game to keep me there.

I will say tho, it really does have a charm of it's own.

The things i would practice more.
1. Story Branching
2. Jumpscares
3. Sound Effects
4. Shadows
5. Writing

Story Branching - There isn't really much that let's me ''Choose'' mostly because the choices i do make end up not really affecting anything, also, you die, A LOT.

Jumpscares - i can't for sure tell you the jumpscares are bad, because i didn't play much of this game, so i don't know if the jumpscares get better, but from what i DID play, the jumpscares are just images blurring into vision. i'd say, give it a small amount of animation, and some sudden screeches or growls.

Sound Effects - The ones that can be heard are fairly good samples, but it needs more variation, Randomize the door sounds and maybe some sounds the let's you know  that something is further ahead, also use some panning on some of the sounds relevant to the side it's coming from.

Shadows - Not much to say, but more detailed shadows, also maybe mix it up, maybe let the statues move sometimes, but only a little, to give the feeling that ''Something is different''

Writing - It's fairly ok, but maybe change the text's for when you move back on your adventure, something like ''You came to the conclusion that you couldn't do much there, and walked back, thinking of your next move you decide to''
give it some variation, and let people know that everything that one does, is actually noticed.
It's the details.

But all in all i'd say it's an ok game for what it is.

DISCLAIMER: i didn't play more than about 20-30 min of this game, it could just be because it's not my type of game, you might end up enjoying it, and i would definetly recommend you try it before judging it.

Also. Have a nice day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029075979', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1553800580}
review:
[h1] A somewhat abstract, trial-and-error horror VN about a mysterious disease-like darkness that plagues the land. Short-ish and fully wrapped up in spooky, depressing vibes and visuals.[/h1]

-> Monochrome visuals that aren't too spooky, but they do give a slight thrill in a non-jumpscare sort of way.

-> Fun/thrilling deaths that reward you with funny achievements. 

-> Multiple save slots for your convenience.

-> Many routes (albeit usually short, ending in death).

-> Somewhat short playthrough.

-> Exploring rewards/punishes you, so I'd recommend utilizing more than one save slot. >1 save slot also really helps with gathering achievements.

-> There is a walkthrough on Steam for this game, an "auto" feature, and a "skip" feature, so if you want to backtrack that way or blaze through achievements, you are able to.

[i]Edited for formatting purposes.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1553037011}
review:
Lot to like about Disturbed, but the gameplay was not for me at all. It is a no cost game, so might as well try it.

You repeatedly reload your game, after every two or three choice selections. Typical gameplay action looks like: "Choose door A, door B, or door C ?"...choose door A... die!... reload... choose door B... die!... reload... choose door C... "Okay. Now, do you choose path A, path B, or path C ?"

Meanwhile, there is some really great artwork and decent sound effects. The narrative writing was totally solid. This could have been a very decent point and click adventure game, had they bothered with an inventory system. In fact, the game reminded me of the classic Shadowgate in many ways.

I tried this game on ubuntu linux 18.10, with radeon mesa graphic drivers. The game had a 180 MB install size. The game is played with the mouse controls.

review:
Title checks out. I am indeed Disturbed.

The first few minutes seem to be an experiment in how many creepy death scenes a player will sit through, but if you stick it out there is in fact a storyline with a goal that your actions make progress towards. Do save often, though, as the sudden deaths continue throughout the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078815095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1547093824}
review:
Disturbed is a free choose your own [strike]adventure[/strike] death visual novel. It is very easy to die, in fact there are 16 different ways, and mildly annoying to win.

It could use some editting, but there isn't anything which will make you tear out your eyes.

While I personally don't like the art style, it is well done and completely fitting for the setting.

My only real complaint is navigating the world. In order to get the good end, you need to do a LOT of going back and forth. It would greatly benefit from fast traveling. 

That being said, its a solid example of a free horror visual novel and worth playing if you are a fan of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198802005602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1544729732}
review:
J'ai passer un tr√®s bon moment devant ce jeu et j'ai √©t√© tr√®s triste de voir que je n'avais plus de mort √† d√©couvrir au bout d'un moment. Sans blague, on peut mourir √† presque tous les tableaux. 
Concernant l'histoire (car on joue principalement pour √ßa) elle est tr√®s bien, tr√®s prenante m√™me si j'avoue qu'au d√©but, j'ai eu du mal √† accrocher. Tout n'est pas expliquer (ce qui est vachement dommage) et cela m'a laiss√© un peu sur ma faim. Je crois que Disturbed : Beyond Aramor nous permettra d'explorer l'univers plus en profondeur mais il n'y a malheureusemenpas de vf :'( du moins, pour l'instant
En tout cas, c'est un tr√®s bon jeu qui, certes, ne dure pas longtemps mais qui est tr√®s agr√©able

author: {'steamid': '76561198149017561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1548041409}
review:
Rather have a neutral option. Disturbed is an okay visual novel.

The Good: Wide variety of selections to choose from. You're rewarded for simply dying. It's free.
The Bad: It's extremely short. There's really no actual explination that I could see why it went from a productive farm to a wasteland. Some deaths are nonsensical. Some could be improved upon instead of majority being "You died a very painful death". 
The Ugly: Finding the combination to the tree puzzle. There was no clues for the answer. The only option was to brute force it or do what I did: looked at the Community Guides.

Do I recommend it? Yes and no. If you're looking for a cheap way to pass time, then this is for you. If you're looking for complex storyline and characters, this is definately not for you. You will likely find it boring. I would like to see it expaned upon however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303993330', 'num_games_owned': 1425, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1503598613}
review:
Disturbed feels exactly like the name suggests, with eerie and disturbing storytelling complete with gritty black and white imagery to match. It calls itself an interactive story, similar to a choose your own adventure mixed with a visual novel. You'll die, over and over until you finally find your way through the ending. It's downright creepy at times, with twists and turns in the story that take you from being a farmer to being part of a bigger fantastical story. 

The storyline itself puts you in the shoes of a small village farmer, who sets out in hopes of bringing his farm back to life. Where you start is far from where you end, be it dying to any of the supernatural creatures you encounter or accidentally falling into a well. Finding the true ending involves fully accepting the supernatural and fantasy-like world you walk into and seeking help to aid both you and your farm from the forces greater than your human self. It's a wildly interesting turn for the story to take, but it feels amazing to explore and read through.

I first played Disturbed a while ago (and am only reviewing it now because I forgot to review it back then), and since playing it I haven't found a visual novel-like game much like this one. The most important unique factor is that it plays like a visual novel, but you can pick where you go and backtrack anywhere you'd like. This has a large part of the story, as you need to go back and forth unlocking areas and collecting items to use. It's a very well made concept that I could see lots of other visual novel-like games being able to impliment well. 

The art style is very grungey and fits the theme of this story and all its disturbing written imagery. The hand drawn look it has is both very well done and gives it a creepier vibe than it would have with top of the line CG art. It reminds me of older flash-based choose your own adventure games that were popular in the early 00's, and carries that hint of nostalgia with it for anyone who used to scare themselves as a child with those games.

Disturbed is a short, free game that has a lot to offer if you like visual novels and choose your own adventure games. For what it's worth it's very well made and highly engaging, giving you a mystery to unravel and many different ways to explore. I'd highly recommend playing through the hour or so it takes to find all the endings, and experiencing this story for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044956333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1538958657}
