author: {'steamid': '76561198054705628', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1538877687}
review:
Disturbed is a well crafted point and click game with humor and dark themes.

A short but satisfying story that will make you look through every nook and cranny to find all the different ways to end your adventure.

The ragged almost scetchbook artstyle is beautiful and every screen is unique and cool to look at.

It's free so try it when you get the time.

Pleasant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003306969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1538687264}
review:
absolutely loved this. puzzles were nice, no crazy cliche horror stuff.
and most of all I like that if you think logicaly you get through. No dumb luck or trial and error like some other horror or choice games. Had quite a bit of fun with it even though it was kind of on the short side.
if you're wanting more of this and wondering if the DLC is worth it, If it's like the base game then i'd say it's well worth it. I'll likely get it soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198860036919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1538393691}
review:
Hard to choose whether to categorise it as "recommend" or not.

This dark-fantasy visual novel is absolutely fantastic at setting the eerie atmosphere with its monochrome graphics and seemlessly mixed sounds and effects.  The premise is simple and solid, but the game itself becomes a bit tedious as you backtrack to and fro, literally cycling through familiar images and blocks of text to get from one area to another.  

As others who chose to "not recommend" this game have also said, there is little logic or foreshadowing of choice outcomes and deaths.  You simply pick an option, suddenly die more often than not (and getting an Achievement), and have to remember to not do that next time.  Having to load so often becomes a bit irritating, and even though you can skip through text, it gets to a point where you're just loading the game, skipping text to the choice that killed you last time, and trying to not get killed too soon again.  For me, after hitting more than half the Achievements, I started losing interest in the story.

A small sound effect is the only feedback that you get for doing something significant (eg. pick up a key item).  Too bad there is no way to check inventory or anything like that in-game.  In the end, after achieving pretty much all the deaths, I didn't have the time and patience anymore to finish the two "proper" endings without resorting to a guide.

A decently-made free game if you have time to kill, are not fussed about a small-scope game, and are feeling patient enough to read carefully and save/load often.  Not great for those like me wanting a faster-paced, positive-reward game, or people who (even with free games) generally prefer not to be left feeling frustrated while playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008621908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1537239965}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022391714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1604184071}
review:
This dark point and click adventure is the story of a farmer in the cursed and dying land of Aramor, you choose what he must done in order to save his failing farm. It really reminds me of the choose your adventure books when I was a child, I think this is a good update on the genre .
I do like the new dlc to celebrate 4 years, its adds and extra dimension to the game and certainly gave me a spook the first time I saw it. It certainly kept the game fresh for me on my replay, though I can see it ramping up the difficulty a bit too much for people who are new to the game.

The puzzles are logical and fairly straight forward, does require a bit of back and forth movements to complete the tasks. As you would expect of a horror game, you will die and die a lot - there are a variety of brutal deaths you can experience and I will give credit for the creativity.
In terms of world building and story, there is not a lot there which can either add to the mystery surrounding the world or can be boring depending on what you are looking for in a game. It is a very linear plot and it means the ending of the game is a bit dissatisfying, as it feels a bit of a rushed ending due to all the holes.

The art is perfect for such a dark world; it is stylistic, black and grey work, and it certainly builds the horrific world we are stepping into.
The music is both beautiful and slightly haunting, really helps create an atmosphere of despair and loss within the world, whist the ethereal quality gives the impression of the farmer's faint hope things will change. The soft background music builds an unsettling atmosphere and allows the main sound effects to drive the eerie ambience.

Overall it is a short game, for the brilliant price of free. It is certainly worth a go if you want to try something different in your point and click horror games, and are not expecting much in terms of story and world building.

review:
Kurzes, aber interessantes Spiel.
Sehr abstrakt und verworren, aber einem roten Faden folgend, den man nur verl√§sst wenn man dem richtige Weg nicht folgt und so automatisch in den Tod geht!
Dabei sind die meisten Tode vermeidbar, bringen jedoch immer eine Errungenschaft mit sich, weshalb man sie auch sucht, um das Spiel so g√§nzlich zu erleben.
Der Pilz wird aufgehoben, die H√∂hle wird durchsucht, man legt sich in sein bett und schl√§ft... Gerade am Anfang sind diese Tode vermeidbar, wenn man nicht sterben mag, sp√§ter jedoch geht man nur durch eine T√ºr und hat schon verloren. Da w√§re eine M√∂glichkeit dem zu entgehen noch sch√∂n gewesen, aber trotzdem hat es Spa√ü gemacht!

author: {'steamid': '76561198105156704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1479917417}
review:
This game was a lot of nostalgic fun. Its a dark fantasy choice driven visual novel, but very reminiscent in atmosphere and the way it's presented of the old text based adventure games with static monochrome images . 

Your choices do have an impact and there are several endings ranging from good to, bad, serious to  fun . Reaching the various endings is a bit trial and error,  and you can die, but not to the point of it becoming annoying (and you can have  several saves). 
 
This game also has achievements, and its free!  Well worth checking out for adventure fans as well as those who like visual novels

author: {'steamid': '76561197968312284', 'num_games_owned': 2395, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1531996507}
review:
Disturbed is a short visual novel with a dark theme and (imo) very well done hand drawn visuals. 

You get offered a lot of different choices, which often enough will lead to your immediate death (and "reward" you with achievements) 
It's not a horror game and there are no jumpscares - nevertheless it was an enjoyable hour of playtime.

I liked the art style and the overall athmosphere, although I wouldn't mind a bit more of ambience sounds / music.

As it's free you can't go wrong giving it a shot, if you don't mind playing visual novels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045136299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1530447591}
review: Disturbed is a short 'Choose Your Own Adventure' style visual novel. Your goal is to progress through the story by (hopefully) picking the paths that won't lead to your untimely demise. But for many - thanks to the achievements - it becomes as much about discovering the many ways /to/ die as it does about finding that path. And for that (and the fact that it's free (and there's no neutral option)), I'm recommending it. Otherwise...it is pretty simple. (Also, I don't know how it came to be on my list..)

author: {'steamid': '76561198176743631', 'num_games_owned': 1061, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1530487865}

Save often if you feel you're doing well, cause it gets a bit tedious to repeat the beginning. I hope to see more by this developer, maybe a longer game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198052802708', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1530200802}
review:
[i]The invisible worm,
That flies in the night
In the howling storm,

Has found out thy bed
Of crimson joy;
~William Blake[/i]

Disturbed is a free visual novel with complex branching narratives focusing on a young farm boy who sets out to discover what is plaguing his farmlands and discovers his own mortality.

[h1] Gameplay[/h1]
Disturbed has a simple choice system that works by clicking upon the choice you wish to make. Then proceeds further by presenting you with a new screen, with accompanying illustration, text and choice. The plethora of choices is what makes the game unique and it allows for backtracking and encourages pursuit of multiple paths. Built on the ren.py system there are also options to save and load directly within the game allowing you to change your decisions on the fly and ensure you don‚Äôt lose too much progress. 
The game relies heavily not only on your own ability to save with discretion but on your ability to memorize choices that could cause death.  However once certain objectives are fulfilled some obstacles are able to be overcome, such as obtaining a flower allows you to break the curse on a sword and therefore not die when you take it. These objectives take the form of items and give added options, depending on the order in which you pursue them.
This flexibility within the text itself lends itself well to the trial and error gameplay. 

[h1] Narrative[/h1]
Disturbed is very much a homage to traditional sword and sorcery fantasy. It gives nods and winks to various famous events in general fantasy literature, and exhibits a macabre black humour. 
The game begins simply with the standard farm boy, but unlike the Rand Al‚ÄôThor‚Äôs of the grand fantasy adventures, the protagonist (or rather you the player) are bewildered, incompetent and very much in the dark. This is where the brilliance of the simple approach shines through but this simplicity belies the complexity of the branching narratives‚Ä¶ It is very much a game that encourages the player to write their own twisted tales of death. And the game does celebrate its sadistic premise. You will be curious to find out what seemingly harmless scenario might result in your death. The complicity between the writers of the game and you the player, in exploring scenarios that might generate your demise becomes an intriguing activity and the macabre premise results in a strange sense of humour.
The world itself is also simple, a reflection it feel s of the protagonists mind, and yet there are odd depths to be explored. Not only are you given the writing across the screen but also other sources of information within the game, by speaking to an npc, or reading materials in the world, that gives more insight into the situation you find yourself in. The protagonist as a blank slate, has no motivations other than what you the played decide, in a way this situation lends itself as by not fully identifying or empathizing with the character you feel compelled to send him to his death‚Ä¶ something that is truly disturbing.
There is nothing beautiful within the writing, it is plain and simple as indicative of the uneducated protagonist you play. The world itself also reflects this in its way. There are indications of various fantasy tropes (or archetypes) that lend credulity to the world, yet it never truly manifests itself even as you explore the labyrinth of choices that confront you. The world is the danger, and its straightforward portrayal actually lends itself to the labyrinth of choices that confront you. In this way the game foregrounds not its writing but your own ability to drive the narrative forward.

[h1] Graphics[/h1]
Disturbed has a clearly chosen aesthetic, that lends itself well to the overall experience, the twisted drawings that appear to be muddied charcoal on paper, lend themselves to the mysteriousness of the world that confronts you. Monsters and humans appear distorted and unreal, and enhanced by the blurred outline of the lines. 
However as much as this lends itself to the tone of the game, the display options are problematic. Firstly it is difficult to set contrast. The backgrounds and grey tones don‚Äôt filter very well when you attempt to adjust a screen or monitors display. In addition the lack of support for various resolutions leads to an unimpressive display on higher resolution screens or larger monitors (The game has only it‚Äôs native 800x600). 

 [h1] Music and Sound[/h1]
The title screen greets you with the harsh sound of a winter wind‚Ä¶and an organ wailing above it. It‚Äôs gothic and strange and prepares you for the upcoming adventure and then as you enter the game. Silence. There is no music; only vague sound effects that accompany your choices, be it the creaking of hinges as you open and old door, or the rustle of dried pages as you read a journal. And finally a distorted violin sounds as you encounter your death.

[h1]Overall[/h1]
Disturbed suffers from some poor options for optimization but behind the odd display and simplistic fonts lies an adventure just as sadistic as the title promises, that revels in its own blend of black humour.

Recommended to: People who enjoy choice and consequences gaming and complex branching narratives
Not recommended to: People who don‚Äôt like visual novels in general

author: {'steamid': '76561198259414835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1527984997}
review: This game is amazing. It's challenging but not frustrating so long as you follow logical paths. Certain things mut be done in certain orders but figuring out the puzzles are SOOOOOO satisfying. 10/10 would reccommend to a friend and play again. The endings/deaths are creative and intriguing. The black and white color adds to the overall experience very well as well as the sketch-book art style. It's well made and I'm definitely looking forward to playing any other games this developer has to offer. i loved that I could choose to explore territories of my wn choosing without dying at every turn I made. I haven't yet played the sequel but I've no doubt it'll be as beautifully creepy as this experience was. I dislike being scared in general but the lack of jumpscares and excess of creepy was perfectly balanced with the intriguing and delightful moments found within the game.

review:
[b]There is an achievement that you get at some point by getting killed by a giant spider and called "Sam doesn't save you in this story". How could I NOT recommend this game ?![/b]

Disturbed is a text adventure kind of Visual Novel that reminds me of the "You Are the Hero" books, except that it's shorter and you'll die a lot more. It takes place in a dark and infected world in which you play as a farmer who wants to keep living from his farm despite the desperate situation.

The hand-drawn artwork is great and there are musics and sound effects to create an horror and a bit more immersive atmosphere. The writing is surprisingly good for a free game. There are many routes to explore ; even if at the beginning you'll have the feeling that there is always an option that kills you and another that allows you to continue, it becomes more interesting the more you play and you will need several runs (or a lot of loading) to solve all the puzzles in order to finish the game one way or another.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1467161248

[b]Pros :[/b]
[list]
    [*]Free to play
    [*]Choose Your Own Adventure
    [*]Awesome artstyle
    [*]Dark and intense atmosphere
    [*]Cool animations
    [*]A lot of paths / exploration
    [*]Good writing
    [*]17 achievements
    [*]A lot of save slots (as many as you'd like)
    [*]Update (July 2018) that improved the visual, added animated images and sounds
    [*]Different endings
[/list]

[b]Cons :[/b]
[list]
    [*]1280x720 resolution (previously 800x600)
    [*]You'll die quite a lot
    [*]It only takes 1.5 - 2 hours to explore everything
    [*]Can be a bit confusing or even illogical
[/list]

Disturbed is a decent game, mostly enjoyable if you're into Choose your own Adventure textbooks / Visual Novels, or simply for achievement hunters. For those who want some more, there's a longer sequel now : [url=store.steampowered.com/app/617620/Disturbed_Beyond_Aramor/]Disturbed: Beyond Aramor[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198117843545', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1527345005}
review:
Simple, amusing, interesting. This game is 30% replaying, 20% backtracking and 50% death.
A simple, text-based, choose-your-own-adventure type game that got me quite hooked and quite angry at times.
The artstyle is simplistic yet alluring, and the story is written alright. It won't win an oscar but it'll still get a recommendation from me.

Though to be fair, the game does often boil down to trial-and-error. There's a disturbing lack of logic and clarity in a lot of things and I personally had to look up a guide to make sure I got any mildly positive ending. I'd recommend it if you want to spend a few minutes to hours touching about, but free is exactly the right price for it as far as I am concerned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073764076', 'num_games_owned': 1133, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1525647328}
review:
A fun, short Visual Novel, almost borderline text adventure.

With a gritty, dark theme and artstyle, this one definitely feels more like some kind of a text adventure game than a Visual Novel. Also, you'll die. A lot. Pretty much every choice can result in instant death. However, dying earns you achievements, so in one way the game does reward you for exploring, even if it'll end with your death most of the time. In fact, trying to get all of the achievements (deaths) is a pleasant way to play this game - Many or funny, creative, or just plain gritty.

Overall, I liked it. It ended pretty abruptly and I would have appreciated a more... conclusive ending, but the developer wanted to keep it open-ended in case they felt like adding more content or a sequel, so totally understandable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198413350620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1524427893}
review:
Disturbed is a Choose your Adventure where you play as a farmer whose crops & cow have died from the infected land. You set out to discover the cause and take on a journey of paths that unlock achievements as you progress.

The artwork is a simple but effective black & white style , the music a satisfying background noise and the story is written similar to the Choose your Adventure books that suck you into the story and have you wanting to keep on advancing beyond the many death scenes along the way!

Talking of the death scenes I enjoyed the varied ways to perish on your heroic journey as it gave a sense of exploration as well as fleshing out the story and the sound effects are creepy in some areas especially the 'chained woman'. What a spooky laugh!!

Any fans of Choose your own Adventure will love this fun game, it has save features similar to VNs and the replayability to complete the game is very addicting! 

Arachnophobiacs go destroy that Spider!!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Liked what you see? You can find more reviews at [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32839633-Have-A-Word/]Have a Word[/url] ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

author: {'steamid': '76561197976448332', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1524419413}
review:
This is a short horror adventure visual novel with several choices and raw, ragged and atmospheric style. There are no jumpscares. The background music is minimal (a little too minimal to my tastes) and sound effects, while simplistic, do their job and fit within the style. The beginning stages might seem frustrating, since there is no way to know which choices lead to immediate death. The ending puzzle(s) seems impossible at first, but after exploring all possibilities you will encounter nuggets of information which provide useful hints to overcome the life-threatening obstacles. I recommend playing this in one go, it takes approximately 1 hour.

[b]It is a good VN with simple story, and I wholeheartedly approve and recommend it to everyone. There are no jumpscares.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198032573928', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1524240162}
review:
It's a free choose-your-own-adventure novel. Despite several flaws I did enjoy Disturbed so I'm giving it an upvote.

The plot involves looking for an answer to the darkness that has befallen the land. You're given a number of choices and choosing incorrectly can lead to your death. There is some backtracking involved. 

There is one dumb combination lock puzzle. The clues to solve the puzzle are nearby but they are not obvious or logical; I admit I looked at a guide to figure it out. 

It should take only 1-2 hours to beat. 

Graphics are basic black and white sketches however I think this actually synced well with the bleakness of the storyline.  Sound effects are minimal. There are a few spelling and grammar errors in the English version.

If you've got an hour or two to kill and you like choose-your-own-adventure stories then take a look at Disturbed.

review: I loved this game. A classic choose-your-own-story game. text based, original artwork, great over all atmosphere. Don't try to play this game with hopes of not dying/beating it in one playthrough. You have to die in order to really enjoy it. This is an excellent free game. I may have held it to higher standards had it been a paid game, but it's not. If you like classic text based adventures you should give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070202790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1521412777}
review:
Decent game, you will die a lot in the beginning so be prepared for that, but after it‚Äôs straight forward as to what you‚Äôre supposed to do. Decent graphics, alright sound bites and over all a good game, especially for it being a free short adventure. I wouldn‚Äôt play it again, but I would recommend everyone play it at least once. The ending did feel like it was missing something. 
Spoiler:





It‚Äôs odd to me that you went through all that trouble of saving the land without knowing why or what happened or how that stone even got there. It‚Äôs even odder that the unicorn just randomly appears and saves your life at the end after not really having much to do with anything. Call me old fashioned but I don‚Äôt really like a story that just randomly gives characters plot armor. Still a good game though

author: {'steamid': '76561198271634463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1520787037}
review:
I did like the black and white graphics, a definite change of pace from colorful games of today.  I did like the tongue-in-cheek titles to most of the death achievements that I earned, some were quite funny.   I can't say whether there was background music because I play most games with the sound off.  

I'm not sure its worth recommending even for a free game.  I played for a little while but it seems the whole premise of the game is how many ways you can find to die.   After the 5th death and starting over from the beginning, (before I figured out where the save command was), it became a bit a tedious to scroll through all the dialogue again.  By the 9th death and even with having a save point just before yet another death scene still didn't make it any less tedious.    By this time, I was majorly bored so exited, deleted it from my library and erased the complimentary game key from my account.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042869410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1517595203}
review:
Un jeu sympathique et gratuit, √† voir comme un mini-"livre dont vous √™tes le h√©ros" amateur.
Le personnage √©volue de sc√®ne en sc√®ne selon les choix d'actions/directions que vous ferez pour lui.

J'avais la crainte que les visuels dessin√©s au crayon me d√©motivent, mais ils s'associent finalement tr√®s bien avec l'atmosph√®re lugubre et sont accompagn√©s d'une ambiance sonore simple et dramatique.
L'ensemble est en accord avec l'histoire de cette terre subitement maudite pour de myst√©rieuses raisons.

On meurt souvent mais dans des circonstances bien pr√©cises, donc facilement √©vitables par la suite. La mort n'est gu√®re g√™nante dans la mesure o√π l'aventure est courte et qu'il est possible de sauvegarder √† tout moment.
Les causes de d√©c√®s sont vari√©es et il √©tait devenu amusant de chercher tous les moyens de passer l'arme √† gauche.

Autrefois lecteur assidu de ce type de "livres-jeux", j'ai retrouv√© avec plaisir de vieux r√©flexes et la solution au probl√®me m'a paru accessible.

M√™me si la meilleure des fins apporte une conclusion satisfaisante √† l'aventure, elle ne donne pas toutes les r√©ponses aux nombreux petits myst√®res rencontr√©s au fil du jeu.

Il est possible de faire l'acquisition d'un DLC √† 0.99 ‚Ç¨, qui fait office de petit support financier au cr√©ateur et permet d'obtenir le jeu dans sa biblioth√®que Steam.

P.S. : encore merci √† Mia pour la traduction fran√ßaise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008859110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1517563349}
review:
Old-school choose-your-own adventure, the kind where you try, die and try again. It's a pure experience, and it was a great change of pace from more bulky adventure games. Much more Zork than Monkey Island.

Well worth the bit of time it'll have you playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083815420', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1515702403}
review:
Wer so wie ich Kind in den 80er war wird wohl nicht an den Interaktiven Spielb√ºchern von  Ian Livingstone und Steve Jackson oder der Einsamer Wolf Reihe vorbei gekommen sein. 
Diese waren oft nur durch unz√§hliges ausprobieren wo man nicht stirbt durch zu spielen. Hier ist es genauso. Aber das ist nicht Negativ anzusehen. Denn man will keinen Tod verpassen.
Die sch√∂nen Hand gezeichneten Schwarz-Wei√ü Bilder sind einfach gehalten, aber passen gut zur Atmosph√§re.   
Ich habe etwa 2,5 Stunden mit dem Spiel verbracht. Aber als Let¬¥s Player braucht man eh immer etwas mehr Zeit durch das Reden und erkl√§ren usw. Sagen wir also eine kurze Spielzeit von 2 Stunden. 
In diesen wurde ich gut unterhalten. Schade das so wenig Sound/Musik kommt. Vielen Stellen h√§tten ein paar mehr Sound und Musik Effeckte gut getan. 
Ich freue mich jetzt schon auf Teil 2 der irgendwann 2018 kommen soll. So ich schnapp mir jetzt noch mal "Das H√∂llenhaus" aus dem Schrank und spiel ne Runde!!!
Hier mein Let¬¥s Play zum Spiel: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vNvJxSbCyU8&feature=youtu.be

author: {'steamid': '76561197986360343', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 866, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1490529945}
review:
I used to have these game novels in my youth where I, myself, assumed the role of the protagonist. On page 5 I met a knight who offered me some quests. I had to pick one. If I chose quest number 1 my journey continued on page 39. In case a preferred quest number 2 I had to go to page number 24. These so-called "Choose Your Own Adventure" novels allowed you to make decisions and, interestingly, there were a lot of bad decisions along the way. By picking these you immediately died and had to start over.

Now, Disturbed follows this concept. You make decisions and often die (dying is important to gather some of the achievements) so your best bet is to take notes so that next time you will not be making the same error. 

Disturbed is basically a text-based adventure game with lots of hand-drawn, black and white images and it has an atmosphere that the title very well describes. Simplicity means no music and sound effects are only heard here and there, plus, there are some typos but the game can also be played in other languages. On the plus side, the game offers several endings.

It is a short adventure, free, and easy to obtain all achievements. I understand Brad Moore is currently developing the sequel. It will be a must-play for me but, hopefully, the journey will be a little longer this time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360782563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1518814947}
review: This game is simply fantastic. I normally play FPS games but I love games that make me think. The dark tone of the game is the main pull for me and I hope that the sequel is just as good as this. Good work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025823574', 'num_games_owned': 3339, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1516568229}
review: A really cool choose your own adventure game where there aren't normal enemies to be killed by dicerolls... just situations where you are dead. Quite a few of them, actually, and I think this is part of the charm - how many miserable ways you can die? It's just pleasant to explore the game's dark, twisted environments, some backstory and weird enemies. The game has endless saves as most visual novels, so it's not punishing nor robbing you off your time with constant restarts. Overall, it's a really cool free to play game ; pretty similar to Swordbreaker in the die-many-ways fashion :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198113876348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1516481770}
review:
Disturbed est un jeu du type "Roman dont vous √™tes le h√©ros" (√† plut√¥t consid√©rer comme un RPG textuel illustr√©), dans lequel vous incarnerez un fermier dont les r√©coltes sont victimes d'une mal√©diction et qui en cons√©quent d√©cide de partir √† l'aventure en qu√™te de r√©ponse sur ce terrible √©v√®nement. Au cours de votre p√©riple vous allez devoir avancer dans le jeu en faisant des choix qui vous feront soit progresser vers votre objectif, soit √©voluer vers une mort toujours plus ou moins atroce (il vous faudra d'ailleurs trouver toutes les fa√ßons de mourrir si vous souhaitez acqu√©rir tous les succ√®s Steam du jeu. Oui, ce jeu est tr√®s gai ^^).

Points positifs:
- Une histoire plut√¥t prenante qui donne envie de rusher le jeu.
- Des "√©nigmes" qui vous obligeront √† souvent revenir en arri√®re pour d√©verrouiller des passages √† la mani√®re d'un "point & click".
- Bande son plut√¥t r√©ussie compos√©e de petits bruitages rythmant la lecture du r√©cit.
- Une traduction dans beaucoup de langues! C'est rare dans des jeux du genre. Pour la partie fran√ßaise, en tout cas, c'est carr√©ment r√©ussi (m√™me si deux ou trois bo√Ætes de dialogue ont √©t√© oubli√©es lors de la traduction et sont donc rest√©es en anglais on peut laisser couler ce d√©tail qui n'est pas d√©rangeant).

Points n√©gatifs:
- Manque un poil de bande son musicale (m√™me si le silence permet de mettre en valeur la partie bruitage, la musique pourrait mettre en place des suspenses qui sont, du coup, non pr√©sent. C'est dommage. 
- Le jeu est un peu court, nous faisant alors progresser dans un univers dont on n'a au final que peu de r√©ponse. De plus, certains √©l√©ments sc√©naristiques ont une pr√©sence inexpliqu√©e au sein du jeu ( c'est pour cette raison qu'il faut prendre ce jeu comme un RPG textuel dans lequel on avance en faisant des choix plut√¥t que comme un roman interactif.).

Pour conclure, Disturbed est un petit RPG textuel qui vous occupera probablement pendant une petite paire d'heure si vous cherchez √† accomplir toutes les fins possibles. Le jeu reste sympa dans son ensemble; il vous donnera envie de toujours aller plus loin jusqu'√† ce que finalement vous vous rendiez compte que vous l'avez fini d'une traite! Cependant on peut rester sur notre fin une fois le jeu termin√© car peu d'√©l√©ments sc√©naristiques ont de r√©ponses concr√®tes. Je recommande tout de m√™me ce jeu pour le bon moment que j'ai pass√© en y jouant. De plus, le jeu est gratuit et un DLC de support est disponible pour encourager le d√©veloppeur en lui faisant un don d'un euro (tr√®s belle mentalit√© de sa part).

author: {'steamid': '76561198255348089', 'num_games_owned': 1131, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1514099160}
review:
I have to admit, I enjoyed this game way more than I expected I would. The art lent itself nicely to a creepy atmosphere (and reminded me somewhat of Stephen Gammell's work in Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark, albeit not as nightmare inducing). Though Disturbed's story was limited, it was still interesting enough to compel me to continue on. One of the more enjoyable aspect of the game was the vast amount of ways to die. Normally, I'm not a fan of a game that has so many easy opportunities for failure, or those that feel like they practically set you up for it, but that's almost part of the charm of this game (which does provide plenty of save slots), and is done in a way that's entertaining more than anything.

In short, this was a fun, creepy way to burn some time. I was more than happy to buy the support dlc, and I look forward to a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272365253', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1514250742}
review:
V√©ritable r√©plique de "livre-jeu" o√π mourir √† gogo est une obligation lorsqu'on est un curieux qui veut fouiner un peu partout pour voir ce qu'il peut se produire xD
Un crayonn√© sympa qui colle bien √† l'histoire et √† son ambiance d√©primante/fin du monde. Quelques bruitages pour animer, mais surtout pour ponctuer toutes ces morts affreusement douloureuses. Perso, je l'ai assimil√© √† un troll du style "h√©h√©, try again !"

Bref, un petit jeu sympa pour passer la soir√©e avant d'aller dormir, d'autant qu'il est gratuit, une installation quasi instantann√©e, et rapide √† finir.
Merci √† ceux qui ont contribu√© √† la traduction fran√ßaise !

author: {'steamid': '76561198142290491', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1514178786}
review:
To sum it up, basically Lord of the rings: depressing lonely version.

You go through the game making choices to progress, slowly gaining items needed to do certain things to move forward. Most of the choices in the game, without the proper items, will kill you, giving you an achievement for every successful death. You have to save every successful choice you make, which makes this more of a trial and error story than a game, but atleast there's one happy ending to be found.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119666552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1514165391}
review: Loved it! The storytelling alone, pulls you in to it's world. The artwork reminded me of a 80's era dungeon and dragons game, or the early Warcraft games. Can't wait for the sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198178800875', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1560289203}
review:
besser als ich anfangs gedacht hatte.  Netter Zeitvertreib und bisschen mitdenken muss man schon auch. Sch√∂ne schlichte Grafik und ruhige Atmosph√§re und nicht dieses bunte √ºbertriebene Zeug wie es heute so √ºbel √§h √ºblich ist ^^ ABER - eine gefangen genommene Frau nicht zu befreien? Das ist mies. Dass man f√ºr eine gute Tat bestraft wird, nicht gut. Klar k√∂nnte die Frau schlimmes getan haben, aber dann geh√∂rt sie ins Gef√§ngnis und nicht privat in den Keller gesperrt.
 Ansonsten - sch√∂ner Stil - ein bisschen l√§nger w√§re gut. Nur das mit Farm und den K√ºhen ist mies, Tiere halten hei√üt sie gefangen halten. Ihnen die Freiheit klauen. Nur weil man ihre Muttermilch trinken will usw.... egal f√ºr was, heute ist das nich mehr n√∂tig und Tiere als Eigentum betrachten und ihnen die Freiheit klauen ist ungerecht und mies, unn√∂tige Gewalt gegen Tiere... und... wer mit der einen Hand einen Hund krault und sich mit der anderen ein Schweineschnitzel in den Mund schiebt, entspricht dem shizophrenen Idealbild....... >egal ob Hund, Schwein, schwarz, wei√ü, m√§nnlich, weiblich, wir alle teilen diesen Planeten, wir alle sind f√ºhlende Lebewesen.... W√ºrdet ihr auch Hunde essen und Katzen schw√§ngern und ihre Kinder klauen, um die Muttermilch zu trinken.......? Fands Spiel gut, aber Gewalt gegen Tiere ist schei√üe (au√üer Notwehr nat√ºrlich) und Speziesismus ist eine diskriminierende Ideologie, genau wie Rassismus.
guckt mal auf facebook- Tiere sind nicht unser Eigentum oder aufstehen & widersetzen

author: {'steamid': '76561198079120096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1700445740}
review: I don't understand why this game would receive any negativity at all. It's a FREE game, and for the fact that it's a free game, it's extremely well written. The puzzles are clever, the art is original, and I love the storyline. I'm pleased to hear that a sequel will be released. I urge you to give this game a good 20 minutes of your time before spouting out any negativitiy, because it's really an interesting play. Each choice you make effects how the story plays out, which makes it quite interesting, but potentially very punishing! (I'm currently at 7 death achievements, hehe.) My fiance teased me for giving it a chance just on the basis that it was a free game. I was not disappointed. A half hour later, and I'm still enjoying myself. Well done devs! I can't wait to see the second one. :)

- un jeu normalement court ou vous y passerez du temps (soit trouver quel objet √† tel endroit).

Heureusement qu'il est gratuit, malgr√© le fait que le puzzle est assez int√©ressant, le jeu en lui m√™me ne se distingue pas des puzzle game classique (SAUF LES GRAPHISME AU CRAYON !!!).

author: {'steamid': '76561197971154053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1527285621}
review:
Disturbed is a fun little visual novel with a stylish, pencilled-in art style. Though it's tagged "horror" I felt this game almost leans into black comedy territory, especially with the silly, campfire ghost story-esque deaths. For a light spoiler example, if you decide to innocently lie down in your bed at the start of the game to take a nap, you see a strange glowing crystal in your dream... suddenly your flesh strips away and you die as a spooky dessicated mummy! Game over! Each death is accompanied by a goofy sound effect that sounds like a sad little croak and a line of text that you will become very familiar with: Your adventure ends here.

If I had to recommend this game to someone, it would be to the type of person who likes to find out all the different ways you can die in an RL Stine "Choose your Own Adventure" book -- with your finger still on the last safe page of course.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327367911', 'num_games_owned': 710, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1509790431}
review:
Not to be confused with the band, and not a bad game by itself either. Disturbed reminded me alot of the role playing game (rpg) books I enjoyd as a kid. I would get drawn into this strange world, select an option and turn to the page number, and if I then died  or didn't like where my choice took me, I would go back and choose the other option. 
This game is similar and also very unforgiving, and somewhere between all the horrible deaths, there is a liniar story to follow and decypher. 

I was also reminded alot about rpg cliches like don't help somebody tied to a post without questioning why they are tied up, the free gold on the path is usually a trap and the treasure will always be hidden behind a waterfall, you get the idea? But somewhere in the middle I lost steam (pun) and unfortunately since this was not a book, I couldn't just skip to the ending. It is not that the game is bad, it isn't, I just got a little fed up with dead ends and dying achievements half way through. But I will try it again one day just to find out what the happy ending was.

Pros - braught back some lovely rpg book story memories, your choices impacts the game, lovely pencil artwork, unforgiving
Cons - no background music, at times too unforgiving, not enough chances to bounce back from one bad choice and I was forced to reload a much earlier saved game a few times, rpg cliches

I loved the art and if you are into unforgiving rpgs and those old choose your own adventure style game books, this ones for you. 6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1507784262}
review:
The original Shadowgate on the NES was one of my favorite games, specifically because it had so many ways to kill you. Some folks regard this as a weakness but I appreciated both the creativity in fatal hazards and the grim, oppressive atmosphere granted by their proliferation. Later on I became similarly enamored with games like IVAN, Spelunky, and TowerClimb for their vast array of mortality-impairing threats. It‚Äôs with similar regard that I hold Disturbed, a simple text adventure through a fantasy land that wants you very, very dead. It doesn‚Äôt have much more going for it than that, but morbid types will definitely enjoy the ride.

You play a poor, unnamed farmer in a land on the brink of doom. A strange blight has fallen, turning crops to ash and sapping the life from livestock. Without some relief you‚Äôll surely die on your failing farmstead, so you set out in search of something to cure the malaise. Exploring the surrounding environs reveals that the blight is spread far and wide, and you‚Äôll need to take matters into your own hands to stop it. It‚Äôs not like you have much of a choice, considering how all-encompassing the inky plague is.

Disturbed plays out over dozens of static, hand-drawn scenes with choices to make in each. They might be as simple as taking the left or right fork in a path, or as complex as solving button codes or navigating mazes. They never get THAT complex, mind you. This is a simple game, forever ushering you along a mostly linear path with few items to keep track of. The game opens up in the latter half to allow you to scurry about and assemble what you need to stop the blight, but again it‚Äôs a pretty simple sequence of events.

Every scene and action is described with some solid, moody writing that matches the grim monotones of the graphics perfectly. The words are a constant reminder that the land is dying and you are not safe anywhere, and that‚Äôs mostly true because plenty of scenes have parts that can kill you. Some are obvious, like trying to cross a field of black fungus or attacking a bear unarmed. Others, though, are not. Innocuous tasks like reaching into a well or diving into a lake or even laying down in your own bed can earn you a gruesome end and a trip to the main menu. Luckily you can save from any dialogue box, and you‚Äôll need to make the most of that to keep from wasting time on unplanned deaths.

Ultimately the game is a lot of trial-and-error, attempting to do everything until you finally learn the proper sequence in which to do these things. While the deaths never get old I can see how they might grate on some, since it‚Äôs virtually impossible to get through the game without dying at least a few times to unclear choices. That‚Äôs the real sticking point, that many of the deaths feel unfair for how they sneak up on you unannounced. I‚Äôm no fan of this in principle but here it hardly seemed an imposition, granting me enough entertainment from the skeletons and mandibles of my demise to keep me invested.

I managed to finish the game after 45 minutes and a boatload of deaths, so it‚Äôs not unthinkable that old adventure fans could finish it even faster. It‚Äôs a tight experience with a wonderfully gloomy look and feel, though at the price of killing you stone dead every five minutes or so. The puzzles are simple enough that its really more about what order you complete them in than how you complete them. I can‚Äôt say there‚Äôs anything super compelling about Disturbed but I enjoyed my time with it, and always looked forward to new deaths on the horizon. Every game needs a hook after all, and there‚Äôs no reason this one can‚Äôt be strange and varied demises.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064139415', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1507710982}
review:
Empfehlenswert: Ja (pers√∂nliche Wertung: 6/10)

Errungenschaften: Ja (teilweise kompliziert zu erreichen)

Positiv:
- Gute Story
- Verschiedene L√∂sungswege
- Kostenlos

Negativ:
- Nicht alles auf Deutsch √ºbersetzt
- Keine Sprachausgabe

Fazit:
Disturbed ist ein kurzes, auf Text basierendes Abenteuerspiel, bei den man hinter jeder Ecke sterben kann. Das beste daran ist... Es ist kostenlos! Also f√ºr kein Geld ein sch√∂nes Spiel! Wenn man das Spiel mit etwas Verstand angeht, dann kommt man auch wunderbar durch ohne zu sterben. Wer hier Action erwartet sollte jedoch entt√§uscht sein. Das Spiel besteht aus Bildern und Text. Die geschriebene Geschichte ist spannend erz√§hlt und wei√üt mehrere verzweigte Handlung auf. Sch√∂n ist auch das die Texte in Deutsch sind, jedoch nicht zu 100% √ºbersetzt! F√ºr Achievementj√§ger gibt es sogar einen n√ºtzlichen Guide, dennoch sollte man zuerst versuchen von alleine durchzukommen! Es lohnt sich. Erinnern tut mich das an die damaligen auf Text basierenden Spiele, bei denen man seine Fantasie anstrengen musste, um ein einzigartiges Erlebnis zu bekommen! Empfehlenswert f√ºr jeden Abenteurer!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083694852', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1645291899}
review:
I loved this game. It's greatly recommended because:
> free to play
> easy achievements (follow guide)
> reasonably short
> multiple endings
> tension builds up overtime as you explore new pathways
> creepy bosses
> interactive fiction/ text adventure (you can skip in settings to save time)
> decent, monochromatic art
> intriguing horror story (for a free game)

- Can get repetitive so takes awhile to get used to the familiar pathways in order to backtrack. Easy to get lost for ADHD types. Frustrating to play in one sitting.

Achievement hunters, definitely give it a try. Worth your time. 9/10

I nominated this game for Steam awards

review:

The idea of a game is very good, but the game it self is not good at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082934481', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1504378998}
review:
Spoiler warning: This review has very slight encounter spoilers so if you're extreme about any spoilers however so slight/small then take into consideration that there's a few spoilers here like I already said, onto the review:

Meh.. This game is boring..

I feel like the whole story had potential but in a different format, maybe it shouldn't even be a game but instead a horror movie, where perhaps the protagonist goes for every option that would lead you into Death and then he "respawns" or rather is sent back with the memories of his deaths, to then eventually do everything and "win"

Now I'll talk about the game itself
The game is boring, why? Well, honestly everything was kinda obvious and expected, my first kinda surprise was the bear of course, but honestly It was just a little tiny bit of a startle and realization of "Oh, a bear, bears usually live in caves, oh, right, meh I knew something was gonna happen anyways" and I knew in the first place that I wasn't supposed to enter the cave, but my playing style of this game was just go in and see what would happen in all places that gave you the option to inspect or do the obvious thing that'd get you killed just cause I wanted to see what was come up with every time, and also kind of an intrigue of mine as I was more interested in the art itself a game artist. 

So basically, to me, it was more of a slideshow game of "sp00py" pictures and an interesting story with potential that I dropped when I got to the town just because I thought "I just downloaded a ROM for God Of War 1 and 2, why should I even continue playing this when I could be playing that or doing something else?"
And so I left the game and proceeded to type up this review.

Basically this game can be something you'd like to play depending on how you actually play the game and what you take interest/like into

For example, you could go with my "Terror Movie Tourist Route" and go sightseeing while also attempting to unlock all of the achievments.. Which after I quit the game I realized I had 6 out of 11 already, and thought "Only 11? Meh.." or something along the lines of that, or; You could go with the survivalist route where you try to survive and not get yourself into an inescapable death situation like when the bear pops up or when you dive into the lake, anyways, considering this, I can't properly downvote this game even tho I want to, specially considering it's "very positive" reviews

So consider this me being really nice with the game and giving it a chance for other people to try it and see if they maybe like it, since after all, it won't take much of your time at all to install this for free and play it, since you can left click through everything in a matter of minutes, so even if you don't like it, won't be much time wasted

Just remember this, you could be playing some really old great game like Super Mario Bros 3, or many other classics, or some cool new game like Sonic Mania instead of this

PS: This game would work good as a Hentai by merely replacing the setting with a lighter tone and changing every deadly encounter with sex, lul

review:
Interesting mindset / game. 

It requires some backwards walking and certain clears before you can actually progress through the main line of game completion. 

-The save points are a little annoying since it has to be during your text reading and not the decision making part (choices).

Where most save points are the most useful since the player may read fast / skip. Based on dating sims ~ visual novels, and some others.

-However, overall this was a nice viewpoint of the main protagonist stumbling upon the mystery.
 - and the many ways of death.

Well it's free and it provides a sense/ atmosphere during my run. This also provided the fantasy nostalgia that most players would of known/ feel. There are a couple puzzles and text reading required to progress through the story. 

As you get farther from the farm setting you should understand that most of the things you're about to do. Is just going to lead you to death, so think carefully and think of the fantasy atmospheres of every character's death. 

-Shrooms with black veins, what do you expect when you see a dead cow next to it? 
   -It's a magical shroom mate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198385501958', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1494687731}
review:
From publisher and developed Brad Moore, comes the indie horror game Disturbed. Released on the 3rd of October, 2016, this is a casual adventure simulation game where you go about your adventures and try not to die (although you get a lot of achievements for dying).

Play as a farmer who struggles to manage a failing farm. You come to a point where there is no more hope, and you must do something. 

You figure that you will die and it is just a matter of how and where. What difference is there to make? What can a simple farmer do? Only you can answer these questions.

This game is powered by the Ren‚Äôpy Engine and the visuals are 800 by 600 by default. The game runs really smoothly and there‚Äôs no connection issues (thank goodness for offline play).

I got this game around Halloween 2016, just to have a look at what it was, and found the achievements were relatively easy to get. Due to college, I abandoned my old Steam account, and forgot completely about the game. Coming back to Steam at the start of this year, I was delighted to find this again. I was really enjoying it on my old account, so to start it again and see how it went and if there were any updates was really exciting.

I found the game quite easy to remember. I managed to click most of the achievements in ten minutes of play, and then it became a lot of clicking around, seeing where my choices took me, and trying to click the last of the achievements. There was a lot to discover in this game, and it was fun to sit down for forty minutes and click around for a bit. 

It was exciting to see where my choices took me, to find the horrors that waited to kill me, and to eventually beat the game. 

The art style is very simplistic, however, it was still really enjoyable to look at. The sound work did well ‚Äì there wasn‚Äôt much sound unless something happened, which added a tiny aspect of jump scares if you weren‚Äôt expecting them. These are easy to adjust to, however, and the jumping ceases during the game.

This game really doesn‚Äôt take too long to complete at all. As I said earlier, it only took me forty minutes (I think Steam said thirty nine minutes) to fully complete all the achievements. Achievement hunters, I‚Äôd recommend this one. It‚Äôs quite simple, although some of the achievements take a lot of time to come across, especially if you make more wrong choices than right.

I‚Äôm really glad I decided to come back to this game and give it another try. I would definitely recommend this to choice-based simulator lovers, and for achievement hunters as well. Indie horror fans would likely enjoy this one as well, so give it a try! This is definitely one of my favourite games for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014524096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1501945457}
review:
Disturbed is a very short Choose-Your-Own-Adventure style game with the style/technology of a Visual Novel.

I really enjoyed this game. Although some of the deaths are a little punishing (you get killed when doing something seemingly innocent), that stays true to the choose-your-own-adventure genre, so it soon becomes the type of game where you have to "save early, save often, and don't overwrite old saves!", which isn't a bad thing, it simply comes with the territory.
This trial-and-error approach added to my enjoyment as I tried to feel my way around the game and it made it really exciting when I got further into the game and started progressing more and more quickly--it made the gameplay amp up towards the end, which was very cool.
That said, this game is very linear, so once you have explored enough it becomes rather obvious where to use your items once you get them. The atmostphere is great, although I'm not sure it is quite unsettling enough to label as a "horror" game. The additional sounds like the spashing of water if you dive in the lake, or the meloncholy whine when you die are a nice touch.
I can see a lot of potential where they could have added multiple paths or ways to defeat obstacles or simply added more depth to the story, but seeing as how this game is free, these things are merely additional bells and whistles.

If you're a fan of Choose-Your-Own adventures and want to play something short with easy achievements, you should definitely give 'Disturbed' a try!

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198164151349', 'num_games_owned': 2681, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1501862614}
review:
I gave this game a try on the recommendation of some of my Steam friends, and was not disappointed at all. :) 

This is a sort of Choose-Your-Own-Adventure style game, where you progress through the story by making decisions about what to do next. Every decision affects the outcome (unlike some other games - [i]*cough cough* Telltale Game of Thrones *cough cough*[/i] - where choice is but an illusion). 
What I [i]really[/i] liked though, was the fact that [i][b]when[/b][/i] you make those decisions, matters. For instance, you may come to a scene as yet unequipped with a certain inventory item, and if you choose to make a particular decision before you have that inventory item, you could end up losing your life.

Where the adventure gaming component is concerned, while you don't have an actual inventory that you can open and look at, the game keeps track of what items you have picked up and will automatically apply them for you when needed. This was a pretty neat system and it worked perfectly for this game.

Story-wise, the premise was intriguing enough to get me started, and the pacing & progression done well enough to keep me interested. 

There is minimal atmospheric sound and no music, but whatever audio there was, was done very well. My favourite was [spoiler]the woman's evil laugh echoing for a few scenes after you leave the basement[/spoiler].

Graphics were simple black-and-white sketches, but they conveyed the environment and mood perfectly, and I have no complaints at all. 

Perhaps my only gripe would be the not-so-perfect English. There were some phrasing, grammatical and eloquency issues, but none which were major enough to subtract from the overall enjoyment of the game.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
"Disturbed" is a fine example of how a lot can be accomplished with a little, and that you don't need fancy art, music and whatnot to craft a good, compelling piece of work. I highly recommend this game to all old-school adventure game lovers, especially those who've been around since the days of text adventure games for 286s and DOS!

[b][u]Note[/u][/b]
As of the time of my writing this review, "Disturbed 2" is in the works. It looks at this point to be a prequel to this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122801462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1500724495}
review:
Ich war anfangs skeptisch. Textbasiertes Horrorspiel? Keine Animationen, keine Action oder d√ºsteren Orte? Kann das √ºberhaupt etwas gutes sein?. Dann spielten wir es mit Freunden gemeinsam in einem Livestream.

Ich kann garnicht erkl√§ren wie GUT dieses Spiel ist. Es packt einen vom ersten Augenblick an. Die Zeichnungen sind Minimalistisch aber dennoch sehr gut und passend f√ºr das Setting. Die Story ist verworren und uneinsichtig, so dass man ersteinmal getriggert wird, sie selber heraus zu finden. Viele verschiedene M√∂glichkeiten, eine d√ºstere Umgebung und ein Hauch von Unwohlsein geben dem Spiel das richtige Feeling.

Positiv:
- Spannend geschrieben
- Passende Bilder
- Gute Story
- Viele M√∂glichkeiten

Negativ:
- Leider zu Kurz
- Spiel endet sehr abrupt
- Leider kein komplettes Backtracking

Ich kann euch das Spiel wirklich nur ans Herz legen. Ich hoffe dass sich der Entwickler/die Entwicklerin die Zeit nimmt, um ein l√§ngeres Spiel zu erstellen. Von mir aufjedenfall ein klares JA!

author: {'steamid': '76561198123045205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1500663741}
review: I thought that this was a decent way to spend a few hours.  You really have to pay attention to every little thing and try to remember it all. I enjoyed playing through the game without the guide, but for the last achievement (the other ending), the guide made it much easier!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093505294', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1500568779}
review:
Textbasierte Spiele sind so eine Sache, textbasierte Horrorspiele erst recht. 
Ich habe mich ohne gro√üe Erwartungen an dieses Spiel herangewagt. 
Es hat mich seeeehr positiv √ºberrascht, wie gut die Storyline, die Optionen und auch die ganzen einfach gezeichneten Bilder waren. Bis zum Ende ist das Spiel eine Herausforderung, man muss mitdenken und die Handlung verbirgt einige Twists, die man so nicht unbedingt erwartet, sodass die Spannung oben gehalten wird. Das Ende war leider etwas abrupt, man h√§tte dort noch einiges ausbauen k√∂nnen. Trotzdem erweckt das Ende Neugier und Freude auf einen weiteren Teil!

Fazit:
Klarer Daumen hoch f√ºr dieses Spiel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198369952763', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1500237153}
review: Though I'm ranking this as disliked, I didn't actually dislike this game, per se - it was more in the "meh" department. As an avid player of free VNs, it was better than a lot of the mediocre dreck I come across. I liked the art quite a lot, and I thought the concept was interesting - getting achievements for every bizarre way you could come to a grisly end was kind of enjoyable, too. My biggest complaint about this game is that [spoiler] you never find out what's causing the pestilence, or what happened to any of the creatures you came across. Are all these creatures supposed to be monsters, or has the pestilence made them so? Was the woman always a malevolent spirit, or was she once a person that has now been corrupted? Why can your nightmares kill you, and is that connected to the pestilence, or something else entirely? Nothing is really explained, and you never find out any answers other than "pestilence is evil, light will stop it". [/spoiler] Due to the lack of payoff in the ending, I don't know that I can strongly recommend this game. But if the people behind this game ever make another, lengthier game, I might check it out, because clearly they've got some unique ideas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128780643', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1478061252}
review:
Bastante disfrutable si lo tomas como experiencia rara y bizarra.
Apartado art√≠stico aceptable teniendo en cuenta que lo hizo todo s√≥lo una persona, la historia es simple pero puesta en textos muy agradables de leer... como un libro narrado con ganas.
Pero... lamentablemente, es todo lo que ofrece. 
Es un point and click, esto por si solo no es algo malo, pero el sistema jugable aqu√≠ se basa DEMASIADO en el ensayo y error, y estar m√°s de una hora haciendo clicks a sitios y cosas que quiz√°s no sirvan ni lleven a nada te frustrar√° much√≠simo antes de llegar a la √∫ltima zona del juego. Por suerte esto se le puede llegar a perdonar, es un juego bastante corto de completar.
Pese a todo, lo recomiendo. 
Como dije, si lo tomas como una experiencia de autor sin muchas pretenciones, es bastante correcto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129936651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 477, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1607127572}
review:
Before I begin this is a remake of my old review. Disturbed is a great horror, choose your own adventure like game. Let‚Äôs get into the story.

A farmer whose crops and cow have mysteriously contracted a plague that's killing them, his only hope to save his dying land is to travel and find out what is the cause of this plague. 
So what‚Äôs the likes. The game has a good creepy atmosphere as you travel through a medieval land. The new art is very good even better than the old art. The story is good as you find out what caused the strange plague, I also like the choose-your-own-adventure feel to the whole game.

The deaths you can get can range from funny or very scary, mostly scary. The game‚Äôs music and sound is good I like how they added some more sound to it witch I liked. 

The levels are nice to explore and there are some parts where I just stopped and marveled at it.

So what‚Äôs the Dislikes. The new death where if you take too much time in the game a ghost kills you was kind of dumb luckily I didn't have to deal with it because I found a charm early on in the game that protected me, but still that new death was dumb.

The tree puzzle can be annoying and the cave that was under the tree can also be kind of annoying but they're both not too bad.

So all in all Disturbed is a great horror, choose your own adventure like game. With a good creepy atmosphere, nice levels and many great deaths to get.

So if you‚Äôre looking for choose your own horror adventure game, this game is for you and I cannot wait to play the sequel.  I all so say get the DLC it doesn't really do anything but its $0.99 and it will help support the maker of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079759258', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1497790294}
review:
You begin your journey on this game as a helpless farmer, who has seen his cow and crops die to a plague of unknown origins. You take it upon yourself to find the cause of such plague and try to put an end to it.

This is basically a point and click exploration game. Different choices you make will result in different consequences - usually, your death - and it will take some patiente and lots of trial and error for you to finally start making progress towards staying alive and actually playing through the storyline.

I'm guessing in the beginning it can get annoying for some people, especially when you get stuck, but I really enjoyed the detailed way the game was written, the discriptions of each scenery kept me engaged. Plus, I like games and I love a good challenge.

There are 17 achievements for this game: 15 based on different ways you can die, 1 for a bad ending and 1 for the good ending. If you have some patient and like puzzles, this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128580196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1497425967}
review:
This game evoked some major nostalgia. It reminded me of the times when I was little, and played these made-up adventurous mini-choice games with my friends with different endings through talking. Probably unrelatable...

Anyway, I have had a lot of fun with this simply drawn choice game, with very many endings. The more I played, the more the right path shaped, and I was increasingly more curious about what would happen next. There are so many points in the game that are so satisfying when you finally succeed after getting stuck on/failing those.

The "good" ending was one hell of a ride. Truly recommend this semi-hidden gem of a game I have luckily stumbled upon.

Mas me chamou aten√ß√£o pelo nome, normalmente n√£o gosto de jogos do estilo (de ir escolhendo op√ß√µes para te contar uma hist√≥ria) mas achei interessante e acabei jogando ele inteiro. Talvez seja interessante para algu√©m que n√£o tenha nada mais pra jogar...

author: {'steamid': '76561198012111055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1496514770}
review:
Una p√©rdida de tiempo. 

S√© que es gratis y que alguien ha realizado un esfuerzo para crear esto, y normalmente le dar√≠a un pulgar hacia arriba s√≥lo por eso, pero es que ni siquiera el esfuerzo que haya podido hacer me parece merecedor de ello. Porque tampoco es que haya tenido que programar gran cosa para obtener esto. La redacci√≥n es pobre, la historia inconsistente, las elecciones absurdas. Cualquiera podr√≠a escribir esto en una tarde de aburrimiento. Lo s√© porque me encantan las ficciones interactivas, tengo algunas escritas y he le√≠do centenares de ellas. Cualquier cosa que encontr√©is en 'The interactive Fiction Database' (que son tambi√©n gratis) supera esto.

La historia, por llamarlo de alguna manera, consiste en una serie de escenas que se suceden donde la mayor√≠a de las decisiones te matan. Quiz√°s resulte gracioso que cada muerte sea un logro pero yo, sinceramente, no encuentro la gracia. Adem√°s nada tiene un verdadero sentido: ni lo que haces, ni lo que te sucede... Es prueba y error.

Dicen que hay un final donde no mueres y supongo que es cierto pero despu√©s de recomenzar varias veces no estoy interesado en encontrarlo porque tampoco me intriga.

My only regret : the lack of music. :/

Ce jeu est un pur chef d'oeuvre! J'ai pass√© un tr√®s bon moment.
Les dessins sont magnifiques et plongent le joueur dans une ambiance sombre et myst√©rieuse.
L'histoire est int√©ressante et le jeu a une bonne dur√©e de vie si l'on prend la peine d'explorer toutes ses possibilit√©s.
Seul regret, le manque de musique. :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1494238744}
review:
Vous √™tes un pauvre fermier prisonnier d'un univers compos√© d'images fixes crayonn√©es en noir et blanc o√π s√©vit une maladie qui d√©vaste les champs et cause des ravages chez les animaux.

Vous √™tes confront√© √† une succession de choix tel que aller √† gauche ou √† droite, entrer ou non dans une maison, inspecter une grotte ou un puit, engager la conversation avec un personnage ou poursuivre votre chemin.
Chaque r√©ponse vous conduit √† peu de choses pr√®s soit √† un nouveau choix, soit √† la mort synonyme de fin de partie.

On recommence donc encore et encore le jeu en prenant √† chaque fois soin d'√©viter les situations qui nous ont √©t√© fatales lors des parties pr√©c√©dentes.

Les textes sont traduits en fran√ßais, sauf quelques phrases. Bizarre.


Apr√®s avoir encha√Æn√© une douzaine de morts, je sais pas trop pourquoi je pourrais avoir envie de continuer √† jouer.
Je vais laisser le jeu un peu de c√¥t√© le temps que revienne peut-√™tre la curiosit√© de faire √† quoi tout cela rime.

Pour l'instant, je ne recommande pas le jeu, malgr√© sa gratuit√©.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312790413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1493671403}
review:
A well done game (or visual novel). I favor how imerssive it was. I was quite fond of the story, especially about the choices you make will continue your journey, or end it right there. I heard that there has been a lot of controversy about the lack of combat mechanics. This is basically a book with multple endings, not a comabt simulator. 

It is a good tale to read / game to play when you just want to sit back and relax or just enjoy something quiet and simple

I look foreward to Disturbed 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026950249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1492717220}
review: Simple adventure game with charming art style.  The game is basically just exploring the decision tree of a choose-your-own-adventure story, so it's not going to blow your mind, but it was enjoyable.  And it's free, so hey.

If you like point and click adventure games, go ahead and try it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084855247', 'num_games_owned': 1237, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1492037969}
review:
Es una novela visual donde nos narra una peque√±a historia en la cual deber√°s encontrar el camino para sobrevivir y completar tu objetivo.
El juego no es muy largo en si, pero me gusto bastante, la tem√°tica es curiosa con imagenes en blanco y negro, un mont√≥n de decisiones a tu alcanze para lograr llegar a un final,  pues en total tiene 17 finales (cada cual con un logro) y solo en uno vas a lograr sobrevivir  ¬øEstas preparado para no morir? Ten valor y adentrate a la aventura, y prueba cuanto tiempo podras estar vivo en esta historia. 

Definitivamente lo recomiendo, en una horas mas o menos habras conseguido todos los finales, aparte de que es bastante entretenido, esta en varios idiomas y es gratuito. Si te gusta el misterio, la aventura, tener que tomar decisiones y las novelas visual de este estilo, juegalo :D

Saludos

review:
Wow, d'habitude c'est vraiment pas mon genre de jeu, quand je fais des visual novel c'est pour les succ√®s/jeux termin√©s. 

Pour la premi√®re fois j'appr√©cie et j'ai pris le temps de lire.

Par contre sans guide avec toutes les fins possible et les erreurs (morts) possible, ce serais beaucoup trop dur de le terminer (Enfin beaucoup trop long et chiant)

Je recommande fortement Disturbed, qui m'a fais passer un bon moment surtout que je ne m'y attendais pas du tout

& En plus il a √©t√© traduit par Mia. Merci beaucoup √† elle, c'est encore mieux parce qu'honn√™tement en anglais j'aurais pris moins de plaisir √† le faire.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198305223081', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1516338368}
review:
The art style reminds me of the old "Scary Stories to tell in the dark" books from when I was but a wee' lad.

Short, unnerving, and you can't finish properly without a Unicorn involved.

This game is a metaphor for what having sex with me is like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268625670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1491372987}
review:
This is one of those choose-your-adventure games and each Ending varies and each choice affects what kind of journey you'll take and the Ending as well - so you have to be CAREFUL.

I find it a not-so-scary game but I really like the artworks used in this game. I have yet to finish the game but so far it has been a really entertaining game, especially the choices I get to choose in the cave (apparently I made teh wrong choice many times '^_^ whoops).

I wouldn't say that I strongly recommend this game to everyone because I don't exactly understand the game plot (and not everyone favourites choose-your-adventure games that much). The game itself is entertaining and like I said before, the artworks are FANTASTIC, very creative and the shades are amazing!
I got lost quite a lot of times in the cave but it made me think of ways of how I could escape "Death" . . . . though Death approached me faster than I can escape from its grasp.

BUT I will review this game again once I find something interesting and understand the aim of this game. So until that time, give this game a try and tell me anything new or make a review for yourself and other people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119057120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1490295677}
review:
This is basically a hardcore classic CYOA game. If you make a right choice then you may pass forward, if you make a bad choice you die and need to start all over again.

Pros:
- classic highschool fantasy plot - we have a roper monster here, an unicorn, a magical artifact, a peasant protagonist and so on
- atmosphere is kind of dark here

Cons:
- it's totally random trial-and-error type of game. If you make a right choice then you move forward one step, rinse and repeat untill you finish the game
- not much of a content here, really

After all it's an ok game due to it's price of being totally free to play. Give it a shot if you like dark CYOA games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278592275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1489525789}

Definitivamente no es para todos los p√∫blicos, pero si eras fan de aquellos libros de "elige tu propia aventura" seguro que te trae buenos recuerdos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116871428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1497598449}
review: I am more of an action gamer. But I love to see something fresh come along from a startup developer. This games is intriuging and beautiful with a unique hand drawn art style. It's a promising first attempt at a game from a brand new developer that I look forward to supporting in the future. It's far from perfect, but for a one man operation, I am impressed. I  look forward to seeing what comes next. My biggest critique would be the lack of music, and that I wish it cost a small amount so that I could keep it in my library.
