review: This is a graphic adventure novel in video game form. It's not very long, and features a lot of death if you don't follow the progression the storywriter intended. However, the game is really short. You can finish it in under half and hour, even if you do encounter every single death. If you are achievement hunting, then you will want to encounter every single death anyway. The game isn't really as scary as I thought it would be. It is really grim and, and a little funny at times. It's definitely enjoyable.

review: This is a trial and error game. No strategy. It isn't actually scary or "disturbing" at all. I can see that somebody put a lot of work into it, and its an okay story. If you want to play out a good horror story, this might be for you. But I did not really enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199251167', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1487601061}
review: This game, is a very wonderful, and chilling experience, there are no jumpscares, so it solely relies on the chilling graphics, and atmoshperic sounds for its horror aspects. It's hand drawn graphics are wonderfully, inserted adding much to the game as a whole. All in allI believe that Disturbed is a good game and should be given a shot. After all it's free :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 1815, 'playtime_forever': 3624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1661561863}
review:
this game is really a gem among the free games here on steam. if you have 1-2 hrs time, 
definitely try disturbed out.

trial and error, great artstyle, great music great atmosphere and easy 100% 

found a chained woman in the basemant of my neighbour - saved her and hoped for something in return ( Õ°¬∞ Õú ñ Õ°¬∞) 
"i will now do you a favor" - were her words and i started to get excited, after a brief second of joy i realised she has turned into a horrible manifestation of my darkest nightmares. "your journey ends here" - great.. This game is straightforward in it's play style. I didn't think I'd like the multiple choice options but I found it's actually really good. The atmosphere is very good in this game, the drawings really give it a unique feel. Being killed a lot is both frustrating and challenging, I've died plenty of times but it just makes me want to play more. I'll have to admit there are a lot of moments of "I know I'm probably going to die if I do this but..." because curiosity got the better of me. I've really enjoyed this game and I would definitely recommend it to people who like puzzles and those old fashioned 'type the action into the command box' game.

11/10 would unchain this woman again ¬Ø\_„ÉÑ_/¬Ø

review: Very refreshing view of the classic reading games where you make a choice and it effects the outcome. Love the creepy black and white pencil drawn artwork.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358229508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1483862013}
review: When I downloaded this game, I was expecting a different experience. Something more fitting for the title itself. Instead, I got a very rewarding, immersive experience. I loved the idea that your choices had consequences most of the time and actually laughed at the some of the death scenes. The story intrigued me from the get-go and was well-written. It was fun, exploring the world in its entirety and revealing secrets through trial and error. I haven't played many horror games myself, but.. I have to say, this was the best and most unique I've ever ventured into. I'm surprised such an amazing, wonderfully rendered game is available free. Definitely worth all the backtracking required, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198342375964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1486147806}
review:
A creepy and dark horror text-adventure - I love it! 
The artwork, which drew me to this game in the first place, is done entirely by hand with a black ink pen by the game's developer.  It suits the game very appropriately, as it is dark, gritty and has somewhat violent aspects to it. Only suggestion I can make is that I wished it had a subtle score or music to it instead of none, but the sound effects and noises that take place as you play do create a good, creepy atmosphere.
If you like horror and text adventures; this is the game for you! Please give it a play, and help support the developer; Iblackpen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059815896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1483607313}
review:
Je trouve ce jeux int√©ressant que je vais vous expliquer en plusieur point :

-L'histoire : Vous √™tes un simple fermier qui cherche √† comprendre pourquoi dans sa ferme tout se meurt. Vous allez donc explorer les environs pour en savoir plus et trouver un moyen de rem√©dier au probl√®me. 

- Les graphismes : Le cr√©ateur de ce jeu √† fait en sorte de limiter les couleurs pour accentuer le c√¥t√© angoissant et malsain de l'histoire de notre ch√®re h√©ros . Le style graphique est bien travailler pour moi et donne une atmosph√®re unique.

-Le son : Pour ceux qui est musical c'est plutot des sons d'environment pour gagner en sensation . Si vous chercher de belle conception passez votre chemin.

-Le gameplay : Ce que je trouve bien dans ce jeu c'est son gameplay. On as besoin juste d'une sourie. Le reste c'est de la lecture et de la m√©moire pour finir ce jeu.

-Les morts : Dans cette univers TOUT peut vous tuer si vous ne faites pas attention. Donc veuillez sauvegardez souvent.

Je les fini rapidement et en laissant deux succes . Si vous cherchez un petit jeu pour passez le temps je vous le conseille.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158196956', 'num_games_owned': 3737, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482974096}
review:
[b]Disturbed[/b] takes place in Aramor, a kingdom suddenly overcome by darkness. As a farmer, you step out of your comfort zone and adventure yourself on what ends up being a tremendous quest.
Created fully with handwritings by the artist, [b]Disturbed[/b] is a dark novel visual that could clearly work as a point and click game. Short, but sufficient enough to give players a notion of the world around the character, with plenty tips being given, and deaths to match.

The game is free, but it's pure gold. Sure, it has some predicted moments, but the puzzles are fun and very intuitive, plus the multiple ending makes it worth a second playthrough!
One may say the hand draw is amateurish, but I like to think there's an emotion to every trace! It's not everyday that I get to appreciate a very dark and intimate game.
At the end, I had more questions than answers and this is a good sign, especially because Disturbed 2 is confirmed at this point in time.

If you like Visual Novels and Horror, with classic puzzle solving, this is for you!
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198253303586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1477484246}
review:
Vine con un poco de escepticismo a este juego, pero me alegro de haber encontrado una aventura grafica que es algo mas que un clicker.
El juego tiene un apartado art√≠stico impresionante, muy al estilo de dibujos satanicos de ni√±os de parvulitos, pero la historia empieza genial, con un grangero el cual va a buscar una cura para su cosecha y acaba fatal,simplemente fatal.
(Spoiler) ¬°¬°¬°UN PUTO UNICORNIO TE SALVA DE LA MUERTE POR HABER DESTRUIDO UN CRISTAL OSCURO CON APARENTEMENTE, EL PODER DE LA AMISTAD CONTENIDO EN UN ANILLO ALIMENTADO POR LA MAGIA DE UN STONEHENGE SIN COPYRIGHT DIVINO!!!
Pero es gratis :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197995361544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1482604924}
review:
I saw this game was free and I decided to give it a try. What an amazing surprise! This is an interactive game that kept me focused from the beginning to the end. Unfortunately, it's very short. You can increase the gameplay time by following every path provided by the diferent combinations of choices.

If you are looking for a very fun experience that takes no longer than an afternoon, you'll like this game a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213098768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1561707101}

author: {'steamid': '76561198125000055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1482529906}
review: I couldn't get anywhere or do anything but i found a knife and I stabbed all the things (even though it failed)! LOL. I was laughing so much at this goofy little thing. I don't know if it's a story or if you are suppposed to be able to solved it but I explored every option available to be and it was entertaining, if short. I can see this being a very amusing party game when you don't warn people about the dying. Being free makes this totally worth a download.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159504807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1482359077}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152668611', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1574401015}
review:
YES

I'm not really a fan of point and click games, but this one got me so HYPED when I actually started to solve the puzzles, and it was REALLY fun to play!

And the clever death achievements made me laugh.

Thanks for making an awesome game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119110534', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1482208027}
review:
This is well played out in the story. The art is great with the mood of the story. Achieving the all the acheivements was funny, frusterating, and satistfying. I wish there was more to this. I would really recomend this to anyone who just wants to enjoy a puzzling story. 

(I did not look up a walkthough for this, I just kept testing out and thinking about the puzzles! :3)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999571966', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1663108002}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zRvcN9Rg-3g

A little bizare choose your own adventure. Artistic style is simple, yet effective. And about everything intends to murder you. Fun game when you're bored and looking for a free game that will give you the jibblies.

Video only shows about the first half of the game with quite a few bad ends... but doesn't give away too much. Give it a go, the game is good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989666263', 'num_games_owned': 5131, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1481667882}
review: Disturbed is an entertaining dark fantasy visual novel.  Those who grew up lost within the Underground Empire of [i]Zork[/i] or [i]Choose Your Adventure[/i] novels will instantly feel at home here.  The storyline has branching options but most will lead toward doom.  Few options reward the player.  Instead, every choice carries the gravity of possible death behind it.  The atmosphere is oppressive and intriguing.  [i]Disturbed[/i] is FREE and well worth taking for a quick spin.  Just do not expect to breeze through it without the trail-and-error experimentation of bygone eras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142759603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1481666061}
review: Actually quite enjoyable despite being only about clicking and black-and-white. Only takes about an hour and is quite interesting, can't say I've played anything like Disturbed. Good atmosphere, with subtle horror elements and puzzle-solving. Highly recommend, especially since it is free.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964722740', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1481069503}
review: This game was built in the classic "choose your adventure" style. You make decisions every time, and those might let you go on or end your quest. So you basically have to learn which choices are bad so you can start the game again (or load your saved games) and progress. You may or may not like this style of game, but the setting the dev managed to create is pretty unique and disturbed. Immersion at its best. This is a quick game but you will easily get stuck. If you don't want to watch walkthroughs this will surely be a chalenge. I recommend this because it is free and quite unique. There is also interest growing for more stories about this strange world of Disturbed.

review: Neat little game.  Only took me about 45 minutes to beat it, but I didn't expect hours of entertainment from a free game.  It was very reminiscent of some of the earlier King's Quest games on MSDOS, which I loved as a child and still do to this day (especially 6, my favorite!).  Great artwork and sound effects.  The only negatives I would mention are the lack of soundtrack and the fairly predictable outcomes.  I feel like the ending could have used some more details.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042701126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1522346996}
review:
Great game, it just a nostalgia when i was a kid and played those books that had various ways but only one was the correct to reach the end of the book/story, with a few deaths and restart along the way.

It is a simple concept, and the black & white color help to create the mood around the theme, besides, i cant remenber the last time i died so many times in diferent ways in game in short period of time,  my curiosity quickly turned into a challenge to reach the end of the story in run.

For players that like this kind of aproach, it is a must play, definitly, i hope the dev will bring more of this kind, free or payed, i dont really care, since this kind of work deserve it both ways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117331713', 'num_games_owned': 848, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1480273377}
review:
A very cool and entertaining game, 
It is basically a point and cick story, carefully made with simple yet effective means,

For instance it is a succession of hand drawings with some few sounds, yet the author managed to communicate a special atmosphere around it.

It reminded me a lot of the You Are The Hero book series, because one bad step ends your adventure very easily, in many ways. 

Everything became pretty obvious once I got to circle the area, but it was still a very good experience. 

For improvements I would suggest different difficulty levels, the highest preventing you from saving during the whole game, to increase tension and the pleasure of exxploration. 

Th game can be beat in roughly 1 hour if you struggle a bit, and you could count half an hour once you know your way ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198327623665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1480641913}
review:
I have played this for 2.2 hours and I enjoyed it. Of course, this is rather a "snack" for a short break.
The shown sceneries and pictures matched the games' atmosphere perfectly as well as the sound. Not too layed on thick.
Finding all endings and collecting the achievements was real fun.
However, I was a bit disappointed regarding some places and possibilities which were not available:
(Take care, maybe a lil' bit of Spoiler!)
The locked-up shed in the beginning would have been interesting, as well as finding the mentioned hidden key. Nevertheless, the returning to the house or the shed is not possible once you passed the crop field.
Also the bear in the cave would have been one more chance for action. After receiving the sword I really would have loved to get back and slough that beast with the weapon. However, here the returning is not possible as well.
Ultimately: the city. I was really disappointed when I tried several times to enter the city with any object I could find (even the charged up ring) and I died always. It would have been interesting to see at least a bit of the town.

R√©sum√©: A nice game if you are bored or want some quick snack for now and then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013810945', 'num_games_owned': 2244, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1479587931}
review:
One of the best (if not THE BEST) visual novel adventure game I have ever played! I loved it! Some people might be turned off by the black and white but I think it was a perfect choice for this game. 

With some adventure games, I have an awful time finding my way around but this one was pretty easy to follow and to know where to go to find something that was missing. The caveat for that was that I DID do a LOT of backtracking and going around in circles but when I finally discovered the next whatever, it gave me a real feeling of accomplishment and satisfaction!

And although it is tagged as "horror" (I suppose for kids it would be), it made me laugh... A LOT! After the first couple of "achievements" (read: "deaths"), it was great fun hunting for all the other ways to die in "Disturbed". Although it left me with the feeling that there were a few loose ends that were not fully explained (the globe, access to the city, after the crystal), I thoroughly enjoyed the game. 

It is not a long game and I was able to get all the achievements except the last one ("Don't let my sacrifice be in vain!") on my own. For that I had to cheat and look at Pri-She-Ra's Achievement Guide. (THANKS, Pri-She-Ra!) 

I certainly hope that Brad Moore will make another... and another... and another... PLEASE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198124766127', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1510709397}

author: {'steamid': '76561198154054234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1479581990}
review:
I like the game, but it is not really scary in my opinion.
I finished it after 1.2 hours but two achivements are still missing. If you like visual novels I highly recommend  "Disturbed" as a game to play along the way. But once you finished it, you probably wouldn't play it again because the plot is already revealed and the story doesn't change either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119287426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1479345845}
review:
Wow, that was actually fun!

At first the artwork was a big turnoff, no offense, yet after seeing Brad Moore's webpage I understood why it looked like it does. It's something amazing to see when someone with a love for what they do to share something so oddly entertaining! Since I was a young man there was something about "Choose your own Adventure" books that kept me enraptured for hours, that's what kept me playing and even unlocking all the achievements to Disturbed. My biggest compliant is that there isn‚Äôt more, it‚Äôs too simple; stretching out the meaning to why the evil, what happened after the farmer wins, what happens to the city or even what becomes of the freaking unicorn!! I want more and can't wait to see another creation brought before the masses.

review:
It is an interesting concept. It is short, but has many endings. It is like a Choose your Adventure format book simply transferred to an animated format.

It is a good way to waste a few minutes of your time. It isn't something I would play for a long time. I don't see how you could, but it is fun and great for quick entertainment.

review: Whoaa, so I played this game with a friend going together and exploring all the options one by one what felt like no time at all playing this game an hour had already passed. I highly reccomend trying this game as it's good qulity and is a great game to pass the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059559153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1479328104}
review:
I thoroughly enjoyed this game, in one word? Brilliant.

From the art style, death descriptions and general pace - I am hugely impressed.

Love the writing style; this is definitely a game worth dying for! (You'll know what I mean if you dare to play!)
Puzzles - tick. Deaths - tick. Creepy art style - tick.

Looking forward to more like this in the future.
Pro + 
+ Beautiful in a twisted disturbed way. 
+ The quick save feature is AMAZING.

Con - 
- If you can't commit to a little bit of story and puzzle-solving, you might want to give this a pass. 
- Not for those who rage quit with a high death rate.

I would definitely recommend this game to people who are fans of text based fantasy games, a little bit of dark humour and those who appreciate a bit of the darker art styles around.

Give it a go. It's short, sweet and dare I say it, deathly good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156671913', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1479052129}
review:
[b]Disturbed[/b] is an eerie visual novel that centers around a farmer trying to find a solution to a mysterious blight that has contaminated his farm and the surrounding area. The song "Dumb ways to die" fits surprisingly well with the events in this little game. Even a simple decision can kill you, but at least you get an achievement for it. The game is based on trial and error and the frequent use of the Quick Save/Load options.

 A free, short visual novel that has a rather simple art style and a few logical loop holes but is entertaining through its eerie atmosphere and mysterious story. 8/10

Your adventure ends here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027688861', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1479347117}
review:
I really loved this game!  I've been looking for good free indie horror games for my Let's Play channel, and finding this one was a real treat!  Trying to find all of the deaths and then find both endings was really wonderful.  All in all this is a game worth playing and I definitely recommend it to everyone.

Great job.  Unique concept with the art style, and really great puzzle game all around.

~Travis Loves Gaming

author: {'steamid': '76561197969812413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1478653422}
review:
A free short (about an hour long) visual novel with a dark atmosphere and a plethora of random causes of protagonist death.

Pros:
+ Free!
+ Does a good job with it's atmosphere and art.
+ Has an auto-save function.

Cons:
- Story is a bit simple and straightforward.
- Numerous deaths that occur with very little warning. (can be a pro as I got a good laugh out of some of them)

My general rating: 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197978877164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1478618454}
review:
8/10 - "You read the review. Your vision goes black and the life is sapped from your body. Your adventure ends here."

I had been mindlessly click-click-clicking when I came acoross this title. Three things hooked my attention, preventing me from giving this title a glance moving on: the art, the reviews, and the "Free To Play" where there would normally be an actual price. So, eh, why the hell not. 

From the onset this game exudes a unique charm that becomes much more aparent and endearing the longer you play. If you have played similar games in the past you might notice a tingle of nostalgia. The aesthetics and execution are just great. The art is dark and colorless and takes on odd perspectives/dimensions that fall right in line with the grim world the dev has created for this dark little adventure. The writing is spot on, describing what is necessary while not prattling on to lose the players interest. Let's not forget to mention that below the dark surface of the story lies an equally dark sense of humor. I was only vaguely aware that dying in unexpected and horrific ways would be so humorous. And die you will. Disturbed is like... the Dark Souls of the "choose your own adventure/point-and-click" genre (You'll see. Just wait until those death achievements start rolling in one after the other).

I found the game. Downloaded it. Played it. Completed it. All of this in a single sitting. Terribly satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061519611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1476883036}
review:
Disturbed is an adventure/choose your own adventure type of game. You are traversing a map trying to solve the riddles. The events are fixed per scene so once you figure it out then you know to avoid it or to trying to fit it in properly in the sequence of events. It takes about an hour to beat.

I found the game fairly mediocre overall, but decided on giving an upvote since it is free. I was not a huge fan of the art, but that is a matter of personal taste. I also found there was not enough variety in the scenes, with the story too linear. First decision A or B; try A, die, so restart and choose B; next decision C or D; choose C; die; so start again, choose B, then D, etc. It is very linear and you basically go from scene to scene and trial and error. After you are a number of choices in, you have to repeat a lot of scenes just so you can arbitrarily die in some decision.

I see this as a poor man's version of "The Forest of Doom." Very similar plot of being in a forest, but much nicer graphics, better decision tree, but costs about $2 on sale. 

Another free alternative to this game is "The Bottom of the Well" - a grim adventure tale, but where the story is actually very interesting and complex.

review:
Disturbed is a short choose your own morbid adventure, which are now better known as visual novel games. 

I was entertained by the many methods of death offered during my time in disturbed. 

At a glance I'd agree with someone commenting on the graphics department. But after playing it I believe it complements the game, story and vibe well and recommend someone putting off playing disturbed for that reason to still give it a shot.

As many people ask; is it worth it? In this case time. Yes. This game is worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020049439', 'num_games_owned': 2611, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1477255589}
review:
Disturbed es una aventura visual que recuerda mucho a las aventuras conversacionales de anta√±o. De hecho comparte la misma filosofia y los mismos patrones de juego de esas aventuras, diferenciandose solo en que donde antes se usaba un parser para reconocer los comandos predefinidos que introducia el jugador tecleandolos ahora se usa un motor para mostrar esos mismos comandos en la pantalla de juego.

Pero en esencia sigue siendo lo mismo y por eso los viejos aficionados estamos de enhorabuena. 

Aunque la mona se vista de seda... sigue siendo un juego como los de antes, es decir, elegir direccion a donde ir en cada pantalla, ver si hay personajes o situaciones con las que interactuar, cojer cualquier objeto disponible y morir, morir muchas veces hasta que demos con la combinacion adecuada para cada situacion que nos plantea la aventura. 

O sea, lo mismo de siempre. 

La historia no es nada del otro mundo y no huye de los topicos acostumbrados, pero cumple y entretiene lo suficiente como para, por lo breve que es, acabartela de un tiron en una tarde cualquiera. Una fantasia con unicornios, fantasmas, torres malditas y monstruos a los que matar que recuerda mucho a La Aventura Original o al Colossal Cave. 

Ademas es gratis y esta en castellano, por lo que no hay motivo para que los aventuretos nostalgicos y los de nueva sangre no puedan pasar un buen rato con este juego. 


6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198164693154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1477917351}
review:
Disturbed ist f√ºr jeden Fan von "Point and Click" Adventures ein netter kurzweiliger Zeitvertreib. Es macht Spa√ü die d√ºstere Athmosph√§re zu erkunden und herauszufinden, auf wie viele Weisen man in diesem Spiel sterben kann. Daf√ºr das man es ostenlos bekommt, lohnt sich dieses Spiel sehr, wobei es abgesehen vom d√ºsteren Setting nicht wirklich gruselig ist. Wer also viel Action sucht, sollte sich eher einem anderen Spiel zuwenden. Doch f√ºr alle die nur einen kurzes Spielerlebnis suchen, ist Disturbed genau das Richtige!
Einziger Kritikpunkt meinerseits: ich fand das Ende nicht hundertprozentig zufriedenstellend und h√§tte mir einen Epilog gew√ºnscht.
Ansonsten - Daumen hoch!

review:
Es corto, lo suficiente para no aburrirte. En realidad no esperaba mucho del juego, pero fue bastante divertido encontrar cada forma de morir sin un prop√≥sito - [spoiler] claro que al final queda contenido "abierto" a morir igual... pero por una raz√≥n m√°s fuerte que la "granja" [/spoiler] 

M√°s que miedo me caus√≥ satisfacci√≥n, bastante raro. La narraci√≥n de cada escena me hac√≠a entender lo que el creador quer√≠a demostrar. En fin, le doy 8/10. Muy bueno, recomendable para pasar 1 o 2 horas:)

review:
If you've ever enjoyed thumbing the decision page of a Choose-Your-Own-Adventure book and reading evey path it offers (even the 'bad' ones), then this game is for you.  A short game but not repetitive.  

This game makes me wish Steam offered a tip-jar feature.  I'd like to support more like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204076723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1477708964}
review:
A very nice text adventure game in the very old school style of those games (no, the first ones of them did NOT have decisions you had to make, only stuff you had to find, to be able to carry on), nowadays some people might moan it's just a "dark themed virtual novel game" but as you never reach the end of it until you figure out how to get to the end(ings) it definitely is an old school adventure game - even it's not a point-and-click-adventure, which is the second point some complain here about... [*shakeshead* I guess a lot of people here have never played an adventure on a Commodore C64, so whatever they call "old school" is in fact quite new and out of the late 90ies or something like that.]

The archievements work as they are supposed to.

So if you, either:

- want to know what an OLD SCHOOL adventure game would have been, if the graphics would have been that good as they are nowadays

- like games with a nice short storyline, that give you some small stuff to explore

- willing to read, because the whole game doesn't make a lots of sense if you don't enjoy the reading part and getting into the short story it has to tell you, which is quite a charming and nice one for such a short game

- like well done b/w-drawing art

- can enjoy and appreciate a short game with a decent storyline

- like a bit of a "puzzle hunt" for archievments

then grab it.

It's free, it's nice to explore, it tells quite a good story (or stories, if you dig deeper, even), it has a decent art part to offer and it will keep you busy, if you like to play a game completly (here this means: unlock all archievements, yes, it does indeed mean exactly that, if you can't unlock them all, you will not have gotten everything out of the game it has to offer you).

But expect an OLD SCHOOL TEXT ADVENTURE game, nothing else, as it doesn't claim to be anything else, as far as I can see.

I enjoyed it, even it could have gone on for much longer, if anyone would ask me. 

9/10 (one off because, well, greed, want the story to go on and on and on...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198007746778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1475737396}
review: It's free, which is always a plus, and I had fun playing through this old school game.  It's like someone was digging into the 80s and found this pencil drawn horror story and put it on a platform.  You take it for what it is, but once you start the story, you're glued until you finish it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963588013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1477476038}
review:
Has the look of a classic textgame except it¬¥s a point and click story, where there is usually some 
kind of options to interact. In this game however there is allmost no such 
things as interactions.

Feels like the maker of the game didnt know how to program good enough to make 
a deeper experience, perhaps its on purpose. First minutes it feelt like there is a story
here. 

I¬¥m very sure that this is the final test after some weeks of programming at a 
gaming course and the students should show what they made as a final exam 
for it, and this is the result.

It¬¥s not a game, it¬¥s a interactive story with very little interaction.

Usually in " games" like these you can take objects and use 
them later on and have some sort of chance
when it comes to fighting and surviving.

My girlfriend " forced " me to watch while she interacted with the story and so we would reach 5 minutes so I can write the review. Free of charge to play it is not enough valid for trying. 

Anyhow I think it still seems like an interesting story developing later on even if you cant actually form your own destiny /influence within the story. I must finally say give it a try if you can bare the first tideous part.  I just remember how good old textbased games was when I tried this...so in that way I remember to check out old golden adventure games and textgames..in that way this was good :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198144689173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1477705171}

author: {'steamid': '76561198254647173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1588418803}
review:
Disturbed - a great game that shows why runtime doesn't matter if you're focused. 

A dark sketchbook aesthetic that does a great job of setting up a foreboding world in which you aren't some great hero destined to save the land - you are small and the world is sick; you are unimportant. 

Text and image based choice mechanic with some great visuals and an interesting method of rewarding curiosity. 

Definitely worth a go, and looking forward to see more of Brad Moore in the future.

review:
Here's my opinion on Disturbed;

Pros:

1. It's free.
2. The artwork is pretty good. I would call it beautifully depressing. 
3. Many choices and many ways to die.
4. Replayable rating 3/5
5. Audio is pretty immersive (although there isn't much, of course)

Cons:

1. This game is pretty short. I flew through it and got 100% achievements in roughly 3 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060524540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1477340146}
review:
Disturbed ist ein Trial & Error Spiel und erz√§hlt eine durchaus gelungene Fantasy-Geschichte, in der der Hauptcharakter zu Beginn des Spiels in einer kaputten Welt aufbricht, dabei der ein oder anderen Kreatur √ºber den Weg l√§uft und sp√§ter erf√§hrt, dass er zu H√∂herem berufen ist, doch weiter will ich die Story nicht vertiefen um m√∂glichst Spoilerfrei zu bleiben.
Das Spiel nimmt (um alle Archievments zu erlangen) ca. 2 Stunden Spielzeit in Anspruch. Die benannten Steam-Errungenschaften gibt es zum √ºberwiegenden Teil f√ºr die verschiedenen Sterbe-Szenarien.
Man muss ein paar Situationen h√§ufiger durchlaufen, aber durch den Skip-Button und die Speicherfunktion kann man das ewige Wiederholen von Spielinhalten ganz gut meiden.
Man merkt einfach, dass es ein kleines Projekt ist, welches mit ganz viel Liebe produziert wurde, was dem Spiel einen gewissen Charm verleiht. Daf√ºr, dass das Spiel kostenlos zur Verf√ºgung gestellt wird und mich gut unterhalten, ja sogar gefordert hat, kann ich garnicht anders, als das Spiel zu empfehlen.


Kleiner Tipp:
Notiert euch was ihr bereits gemacht habt und vor allem was die Aktionen sp√§ter im Spiel f√ºr Folgen haben. So ist es im Endeffekt recht simpel zu kombinieren, macht aber dennoch Spa√ü :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198078519628', 'num_games_owned': 1567, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1574888577}
review:
This is an awesome text based adventure games. I'm a sucker for games like this because I used to own plenty of books like that, the ones where you had different choices and depending on your choice, it would go like "Go to page 145" from page 2. Hell, even the art in this game is pretty awesome, ripped straight from those books. 

In this game, everything is out there to kill you. There's achievements that you can get by dying in painful and terrifying ways. It's a short game, and you can finish it in 20 minutes and get a perfect game in an hour if you're lazy. If not, it can be kinda frustrating because there's lots of trial and error if you don't know where you're going.

I definitely recommend this game, it's free, it's short, it's awesome, what else do you want?

author: {'steamid': '76561198131442467', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1476002607}
review:
Disturbed is a fun and strange novel / puzzle game, and its free
even some achievements if you want them ;)

Includes:
+ nice artwork
+ Strange but amusing story
+ Easy to solve puzzles
+ a skip of fast forward function for those text /parts you have heard before
(you somethimes miss that in games)
+ small replay ability
( since multiple endings )

Spend some time on it, play it, have a laugh, i did.
 a game where when you die it isnt a bad thing, just funnier everytime it happens
[spoiler]expect to do it a lot [/spoiler]

review: Hmm... It's really too bad. With a bit more effort, and a lot less randomness, this had some potential. The story just lacks. Sorry. Can't recommend it in general, but if you like quirk, give it a look. It's only 20+ minutes you won't get back, but perhaps you won't mind after all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198244387248', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1476842327}
review: When I first started out playing this game, I wasn't really sure what to think.  Coming across my first few deaths I was reminded of another game I had played where the objective was pretty much just about finding different ways of dying.  I felt like perhaps this game was similar, but there was something nagging at me and telling me I was wrong, so I explored some more.  I did come across a point in the game where I got stuck and couldn't figure out how to progress further, so I had to look up a guide to help me in that particular spot, but after that, the game completely evolved into something entirely new and fun.  I became completely and utterly enraptured by the beautiful story, and by the end of the game, I just felt happy.  It was a wonderful experience, and I'm glad I didn't just write it off in the beginning like I almost did.  I highly, highly recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198228968244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1476821144}
review: The deaths in this game are stupid and come out of no where, they just blind side you and there is no way to know what you're doing is the right or wrong choice, went to sleep killed me, picked a mushroom that killed me, didnt go to sleep that killed me. the art style is fairly appealing but you're so focused on the text as you're reading so carefully into whats happening so that you don't pay attention to the art at all. the game forces you into situations you don't want to be in. its a free game and i can see the maker of this game got their inspiration from those old adventure book games like ian livingstone but this is so basic and unforgiving to the point its just frustrating and annoying. I think if it was polished and the creator maybe focused on the story and the choices the player can make it would be a better game. i played for 10 minutes and just got annoyed for dying without any reason every ten seconds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112932764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1476539892}
review:
Disturbed is a Free2play adventure indie game with a dark but cool art style. It is single player and rather casual, as it only takes around one hour to complete with all achievements. 

Story
Disturbed throws you in a World which fades into darkness. You are a farmer, trying to find out where the disease that corrupts the land comes from, so you leave your farm and head out. Overall a good story as the World really drags you into it. I did not identify with the character, even though I was making all choices for him.

Gameplay
The gameplay of Disturbed is rather old-school. You get a nicely drawn picture, some text, describing what happened and some choices to make. Often a choice will kill you and you will have to reload a save and choose the other option, but you will get an achievement every time you die because of something else, also was I curious how exactly I was going to die, so I died plenty of times. Do not fear that you will have to read, as it is not described to briefly, but sufficient. Per Place you go to you will not have to read anything bigger than this paragraph.

Graphics
Well Graphics‚Ä¶ The game did not have the usual graphics, neither did it have any animations, but this is part of the experience and why this is this unique. As already said all you get are pictures, but even a potato could run the game. 

Do I Recommend?
Yes. The game is short and may be boring if you do not like games of this type, but look through the screenshots up above in the description you should give it a try, as it is for free and fast to download. I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075488601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1476675596}
review:
So the game is very much like the old choose your own adventure books. Prepared to be a bit frustrated at first. However as you go on and get into the game the frustration begins to lessen. I'm honestly not patient when it comes to puzzle games, but the puzzles were a nice level of difficultly for someone who isn't a master yet, but has played them before. None of the answers were completely bizarre and I felt a sense of accomplishment when I figured the puzzles out, rather than relief like some games.

The art style is wonderful. The artist does care about the detail in the images and while anatomy might not be the strongest aspect at this point, the little things added in make all the difference and make the pictures fun. 

I do think that perhaps a puzzle or two could be added at the start, since that felt very much more like a death trap at every turn as can pose a bit of an issue to get people into the game. Additionally there are more sounds that could stand to be added to the game, but for a free game I really got quite a bit.

In the end, it was a fun little game that changed from frustrating into rewarding and is a nice, quick game to play. Especially as we head towards Halloween.

review:
This game has given me a feeling I have not felt in a long time.

Not fear, sadness, anger, but more like... Darkness. This game is depressing in the best way possible. 

The artist who made these drawings needs to know he is outstanding with his visuals. I can tell that he really can put emotion into his art. This game is too perfect for the halloween season coming, too.

I hope everyone who was apart of this game can make more like this, and get far with their work.


I Love This Game.

review:
Gra jest ciekawym do≈õwiadczeniem dla fan√≥w horror√≥w i zgni≈Çego klimatu. 
Gameplay jest dosyƒá ubogi- ca≈Ço≈õƒá sprowadza siƒô do podejmowania decyzji, rozwiƒÖzywania od czasu do czasu prostych zagadek. Bardzo du≈ºo decyzji mo≈ºe ciƒô zabiƒá- problem w tym, ≈ºe o ile niekt√≥re sposoby ≈õmierci sƒÖ faktycznie logicznie uzasadnione (g≈Çupia decyzja, jak np zej≈õcie do studni) to inne sƒÖ po prostu zgadywankƒÖ- i≈õƒá w prawo, lewo czy w ≈õrodek (jedna z decyzji jest ≈õmiertelna). Du≈ºy plus dla tw√≥rc√≥w za osiƒÖgniƒôcia- po ka≈ºdym dead endzie dostajemy humorystyczne osiƒÖgniƒôcie, czasami z nawiƒÖzaniem do innych dzie≈Ç.
Oprawa graficzna jest bardzo ≈Çadna- ca≈Ço≈õƒá to rysunki, nie spodziewajcie siƒô niczego innego, ni≈º na screenach. Bardzo dobrze oddajƒÖ one klimat zaszczucia i zgnilizny, dlatego fani takich klimat√≥w powinni byƒá zadowoleni.
D≈∫wiƒôk... c√≥≈º, gra jest cicha. Nie liczƒÖc okazjonalnych odg≈Ços√≥w krok√≥w, drzwi czy ≈õmierci bohatera, nie u≈õwiadczymy ≈ºadnej muzyki (chyba, ≈ºe w g≈Ç√≥wnym menu).
Og√≥lnie gra jest w porzƒÖdku, jako smaczek lub inne do≈õwiadczenie- polecam. Mo≈ºna wczuƒá siƒô w klimat, czasami przestraszyƒá, grafiki dobrze oddajƒÖ to co siƒô dzeje na ekranie. W dodatku gra jest za darmo, wiƒôc czemu nie spr√≥bowaƒá? Warto jej po≈õwiƒôciƒá trochƒô czasu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987731882', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1476517078}
review:
A may-seem Intriguing or Rage incurring, clicker and memorizing choices game, 
where in the beginning all choice seems to be leading for death,
triggering an achievement.

All the death sequences are parts of the puzzle leading to the three endings.



Trials and error choosing
Make saves regularly at places with many choices 
or take notes to prevent getting lost in the mist of the many achievements path searching for the one you missed.



Free Game,
Several Achievements,
A Perfect Game.


Worthy to try out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113870041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1476474363}
review:
Well, what I'm going to write here is somehow against the game even though I recommend it to others ..
Here is some of the things which needs to be changed or fixed idk..
1) The game doesn't go "full screen" even if it is in "full screen" the 800x600 fixed resoultion gives me black border lines which is pretty annoying so a simple things is to support more resolutions.
2) The game is extremely extremely repettive so in order to get the "17 hidden achievemnts" you have to choose the same choices so many times even though you will unlock new "texts/images" but you'll have to face the 9/10 same choices for every other achievement you 've done.
3) Unrealistic at all even if it is for the fun but like how will a helpless farmer be faced by this "weird darkness plague" and "unicorns and many other imaginal things" Instead, I would rather be faced with decisions regarding money, seeking help from other characters, ... etc.
But all in all to sum this up its a good 2 hour game of your life I would recommend for people who wanna try a one-time game just open finish the game and never gonna touch again :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197980785450', 'num_games_owned': 2605, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1476406162}
review:
[b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/529780/Disturbed/]Disturbed[/url][/b] is a choose-your-own path adventure game.  It's a short story of a farmer who decides to set out to find the reason for a disturbing evil which has enveloped the land.  It's told with text dialogue which is progressed with choice selections, and is supported by scenes of hand drawn sketches.  

Although it was a relatively short game, I thoroughly enjoyed exploring the possibilities it presented, and completing it.  So if you have an hour or two to kill, and like adventure games, then maybe it's time to find out if you'll like this game too!

Thanks for the experience, Brad!  Good job, and good luck!

[h1]9/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198104925855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1477090734}
review: Este juego es un survival horror visual que recuerda a los juegos como dracula.El juego es corto te lo puedes acabar en 2 horas pero es divertido e inclusos no te esperas que te puede matar en Disturbed

author: {'steamid': '76561198338356274', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1476390185}
review:
I really enjoyed this puzzle-solving game. With every new place you visit, you can make more sense of the places you've already been and go back to fetch necessary items. Getting all of the achievements is a bit tricky, and, admittedly, I looked up a solution for one of them because I couldn't figure out in what other way I could possibly die.
This has been a fun one and a half hours; racking up deaths in a game has never made me feel this successful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323660485', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1476557737}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012221863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1475652670}
review: Okay, this is quite a different adventure game, dark and broody with a sketchy art style. Its easy to die in this game and overcoming the unusual situations takes quite some effort, but in a good way. I don't wish to spoil anything, but if you want some reference frame, think Uninvited or Shadowgate mixed with a Witcher-esque setting. Its free to play, free to win, damn fun, if not very long. Figuring out all the ways to die is fun too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066554242', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1476331238}
review:
You are an old farmer and a strange plague has swept your land. So you get bord and wander off into a memory puzzle adventure. You will meet a white girl wasted unicorn and because it seems there are no humans left because your lazy old farmer ass has no friends and didnt notice the strange wizzard towwer over the hill it tells you that you are the only one left. Get ready to think and imagine.

A kick ass free to play game. I beat it in 58 min and im pretty proud of it. i think i died about 7 or 8 times but you can always pick up off wherever you saved. I enjoyed this play threw. It reminded me of the old goosebumps books. its prety much the same thing. your reading a book and deciding what the main charecter does except you have a pc fliping the pages for you. plenty of mazes and things you have to do in a certin order to win. is a fun play therw and is supensful.
9/10 for this type of genre

UNICORNS AND RAINBOWS!!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198158395960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1479074879}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120911255', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1476316498}
review: Think Shadowgate, except completely text based interactions. I certainly miss Shadowgate, Deja Vu, Uninvited on the Nes and this game takes me right back to those times. Beautiful artwork. The game maybe short, but it flows nicely because of it. No fluff here. Amazing for a free game, and I am assuming the work of one individual. Looking forward to the next game from Brad Moore, maybe assemble a small team and put a game out a game he can charge for, probably be amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081361803', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1558726598}
review: I had about an hour and a half of enjoyable playtime. The only thing I would change would be to add a suitably subdued, subtly eerie soundtrack to fulfil the game's atmosphere. I'll be looking for other projects from the same creator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044963300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1476132752}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978564782', 'num_games_owned': 1417, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1476203202}
review:
Short story, point-and-click type of adventure with a rather dark and slightly twisted Choose Your Adventure style presentation.  Most paths will kill you, and the words, "Your adventure ends here," will become writ in stone before you find certain clues that guide positive progress.

For those who seek achievements, there is a fantastic guide that will get you through the game in about 35 minutes (my estimation, based on choices that took me a bit to re-figure after "ending my adventure here" so often).

For an indie game from an unknown dev, this is an easy, easy thumb up to Brad Moore, and for a point & click game, I rate it thumb up as well.  While it's not animated and glittery, it's one of those honest little games that fills a niche for storytelling fans and those looking for an interesting diversion.

Finally, seeing what the achievements are really for was amusing in the manner of, "OMG I can die *that* way, too??"

Props, Brad - this is a nice diversion at a bargain price.

review: Distrubed felt much more like the books I liked to read as a kid where I got to pick what the characters would do in certain situations culminating to different end scenarios. I was able to finish the game and achieved all 17 achievements within 2 hrs, I had to play the game all the way through. For a free game, it was surprisingly fun and interactive. Death and danger hang around every corner. There were a few elements that felt pointless, but overall I enjoyed the two hours I put into this, especially considering it was a FREE game after all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013769403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1476135305}
review:
The game was fun for how long it lasted, but is not amongst the most memorable of games.

The art and music are bland, but fit the mood quite well in my opinion.
However, the quality of the art ranges from being very on point to being rather underwhelming, which is disappointing, seeing how the creator could clearly do much better, as proven by the few very well drawn scenes.

The writing is fine, but could be more... colourful.
I'd rate it about average.

About the deaths:
(SPOILERS AHEAD!)
I'll use the achievement names for the deaths.
Most of them are pretty good, as they are clearly avoidable. Two of them are not, but... I'd consider them alright nonetheless.
The absolute highlight in my opinion is "don't need a fishing permit", as it is only avoidable by logic if you read everything carefully up to that point.

However, there are three deaths I did not like at all, as they were in theory avoidable, but the player was not given the opportunity to do so. Instead, the choice was made for the player or the player was missing a crucial choice (go back)
The deaths are:
-who's a good boy?
-Got roped by a Roper!
-Sam doesn't save you in this story.

Had those been done differently, for instance by adding additional choices, then I would not have anything to complain about as far as deaths go, except for a single, random death.
"Nature will rise against you!", namely. This one was completely random and thus not very good. It was rather amusing at the very least.

All in all I'd say the game is okay. I can recommend it as you don't pay anything for it, but that's it, basically.
If the creator of this game only made it to receive feedback, then I would say it's a solid start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121525707', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1475675600}
review:
Pretty decent visual novel. Its not that good, but it isnt bad either. 

You are a farmer which leaves his house and failed crops in order to investigate plague that is spread across the land. Story was pretty interesting and mysterious at start, and later on it builds up to a searching game where you'll look for items to progress through story. However, i wish it explained little more about the end of the story, as it feels like something is missing.

I like how the game lets you explore the parts which will kill you, for example trying to fight a bear with small rocks. Each unique death also rewards you with achievement which makes them even more interesting to find.

Pros:
- Unique black and white art, which fits well with creepy story
- Story isnt that bad, and was pretty mysterious at start
- Easy to 100%
- Low system requirements
- Alot of save slots (more than 10 but i dont think you'll need that many)

Neutral:
- Although its a visual novel, it would be interesting if instead of clicking the sentences we could click on objects we want to interact with. However this does would require more development.
- It could use some puzzles to do along the way to make it little more interesting

Cons:
- Even though story is nice, i would like if it had more backstory

review: A decent game, albeit a simple one. Can't beat the price, and I can see how the intended symbolism comes across--especially given how many opportunities there are that seem like good ideas, only to be proven extremely unwise afterward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057462723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1476101629}
review: I recommend this game if you're into choose your own adventure books. However if you are also into puzzel games I would also suggest this game. The art style is very unique and it gives very good detail to the scenery that you are in. Don't get me wrong if you are more of a fast paced game player you won't enjoy tis game but if you do like playing for the story then I would say give it a download and a quick play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233714548', 'num_games_owned': 1196, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1476100577}
review: I thoroughly enjoyed this game. With enough trial and error and reloading saves, it's easy enough to beat, and I can't really say it was challenging, but it was enjoyable. The aspect that I loved the most was all the apparent dead ends (or maybe I just missed some things). There are several points in the game that just appear to lead no where, further adding to the mystery in the game, and making the puzzles a little more challenging. Highly recomend at least one complete play through (all you'd probably need anyways) for the artwork and story telling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152577663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1475961576}
review: One of the best puzzle games i've played!! Once I got into it I couldn't stop! It only took and hour/hour and a half to beat but for a free game it was really good. I ended up drawing maps and writing notes for the game to help me. So much fun to play and solve!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051937458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1475964663}
review:
Was expecting more jump scares based on the store page, but it's much more of a "choose your own adventure" story. You make choices and often you die. There's not much rhyme or reason to why you die in certain spots, so there's a lot of trial and error. One thing that wasn't readily apparent to me is that the game auto saves for you. So you don' have to go all the way back to the beginning if you didn't save.

Ultimatey, this isn't my type of game, but I can see the appeal if you like games like this. For $0, I think it's definitely worth a few minutes of your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102785982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1503421762}
review:
I'm really not sure how I'd rate this game.  Wait!  Let me start over!

I loved playing this game.  It was awesome.  And at a price of... free... it's well worth at least checking out.

That said, I honestly can't think of a price above free that would leave me feeling any affection for this game.  The art is... bare bones, the storytelling minimal, and the mechanics simple.  This is the type of thing that I could code in Ren'Py in a day or two, with minimal chance for review.  And yet, even with all that said, it's put together so well that I can't help but feel that this is actually a very professional piece of work.

And it passes my main test.  It was fun.  I didn't play it long.  The amount you see, around 1.3 hours, is the amount of time you need to complete it, and hunt down all remaining acheivements.  But during that time I had a great experience.

So... this... is my thumb up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086917932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1475907208}
review:
Disturbed is a choose-your-own-adventure visual novel from Brad Moore. Let‚Äôs get rocking.

The Good

How many games do you get for free? There you go; pro number one for this game.

This game has 17 achievements and they couldn‚Äôt be easier to get. Just die. Die a lot and in various ways.

The atmosphere is great and the setting is most intriguing.

The Bad

It always pains me to complain about free games, because they‚Äôre free and I‚Äôm sure the developer put a lot of work into them. See the below section for me criticisms.

The Meh

The art in the game can be a little hit and miss, but, when it‚Äôs on point, it is really good.

The sounds, while good, are much to sparse.

I feel as though the setting is being held back from it‚Äôs full potential due to the simplistic nature of the game.

Verdict: Yea

It‚Äôs a free game. It‚Äôs a good game considering that it‚Äôs free. Look Disturbed up in the Steam Store if you have nothing better going on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982273259', 'num_games_owned': 13627, 'num_reviews': 568, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1475927877}
review:
Certainly very different from the usual "Visual Novel" you'd find on Steam. Personally I found it very interesting, so much so that I played it for a ridiculous amount of time in order to fully 100% complete it. I was even going to create an achievement guide upon finishing only to realise there already was one.

I don't want to say too much as it will spoil the game for those that haven't played but this game is all about making the right choices at the right times. I thought the imagery was very well drawn out and the lack of music only added to the atmosphere. You can't go wrong giving it a shot considering it's free to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013030174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1479952961}
review: Nice little free game reminiscent of some of the old classic 80's text based games right down to the arbitrary deaths because you went the wrong direction or have not gotten a piece of equipment yet. The art and sound production fits the mood of the game well. The lack of constant sound added a layer of discomfort for the player which added to the atmosphere of the game. Not a bad way to spend an hour or so if you are feeling nostalgic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972477319', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1558976612}
review:
Nice lil game. Took me 1 hour of clicking to beat and get all achivments.
Its a trial and error, basic rpg (kinda atleast) "the path is splitting, do you want to go left or right" -"go right" and so on. Nice uncomplicated story.

Fairly easy to get all achivment if you care about that kind of stuff. 

Its free and i had a nice hour playing it so go for it if you have an hour to kill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315917409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1475758294}
review: Disturbed is very thought out and well put together accept for some spelling errors. I love this game and played it a few times so if your looking for a quick entertaining game this is the one. If you couldn't tell from the trailer, this game is just clicking and choosing and all that. It can be creepy and very confusing but once you get into it its pretty easy. I reccomend this game for anyone looking for a short game they can delete in two hours (like me but I kept mine).

author: {'steamid': '76561197973913169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1475772781}
review:
You will be presented with pretty much binary choices every turn. Doughly 1 in 3 of those times, 1 of the choices leads to immedaite death.

Start the game over, or reload form your last savepoint 2 turns ago.

It gets old fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091244599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1475767121}
review:
i would definately recommend this game.
1: its free
2: its pretty fun

what i love most about this game is the really easy saving-system and the fact you get steam achievements for all ways you can die of finish the game. because of the way you can easily save and load games, it is enjoyable as well.
it isnt a long game, it took me about an hour to get all the achievements, but i doubt whether one should want a game like this to be huge.
i would love to see some more games like this.
of course, the graphics arent stunning, but i like the style. the sound effects arent that extensive, but i feel like they really  fit the game and its setting.

ill go with a 6.5/10, but i definately recommend it

author: {'steamid': '76561197982889457', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1475769587}
review:
This is a very simple "choose your adventure" style game, and it only took 3.5 hours to get all the achievements.

That said, this is the first time since I was a kid playing my NES that a game made me take out a note pad and start making detailed notes of what I did so I can figure out where I went wrong for when I'd inevitably have to load a save up because I had gotten killed.

Even with 100% of the achievements, it still feels like there may be some areas of the game that can be explored, and I'm actually looking forward to trying to find a way to those areas.  The simplicity of this game greatly lends to it's brooding and hopeless aptmosphere.  Definitly a game that's worth playing, being a free title, you have no good reason not to try it.

review: A good point and click attempt at psychological horror. For free, I can't really complain about much, but I will say the save system is a bit bungled, since you cant save immediately before making your choice. I enjoyed all the dead end paths. The "correct" route at first was really difficult for me to find, and the tree puzzle was a bit tedious, but once you get on the right track its pretty straightforward. 16/17 achievements as of this review. A little mad that you can't go back after certain points. I would hve liked to get into the shed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122916952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1475698730}
review:
Meh, if you've ever read a Choose Your Own Adventure book, this is sort of like that. Interactive novel with readable text, uninspired yet good enough ambient sounds, and some neat drawings that are reminiscent of the Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark illustrations. Are there better interactive novels out there? Sure. Can you beat the price? Absolutely not. Don't get frustrated at the nonsensical deaths. While they seem to add nothing and come out of nowhere, if you're an achievement hunter you'll want to get them all. 

It'll burn an hour of your time for free, I can't complain. I won't tell anybody about it either, though. If ever there was a need for a 'maybe' selection in the 'Do you recommend this game?' section, this would be it. I'll recommend it though, because hey, it works, which is sometimes not the case for games you pay for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032132936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1475770379}
review:
So I could give positive review, but I got feeling that there are enough positive reviews already for existing problems.

There are at least one positive side: you can get all achievements in hour or less. But this also gives shock when you will find out that out of 17 achievements 16 requires your death in certain place. This makes death not punishment, but reward, which destroyed large part of enjoyment for me.

But even if you don't care about achievements and try to complete game without deaths in first run there are not enough hints to avoid deaths. For example when you choose to sleep on grass or on tree, when you sleep on grass tree kills you and sleeping on that tree seems fine. Or when you just choose direction: some path will lead to unavoidable death, but nobody gives you hints about that. Could be: "you hear growling from middle door", "you see glowing eyes in middle tunnel", "you see some movement under water", or something like that. Journals are absolutely useless, since they have only meaningless information.

You are farmer in dark fantasy setting, but you can read and write.(okay, stereotypes)

I got little enjoyment because there are lack of ability to lose. I can't count death as lose condition because of reward for such actions, lack of leads to avoid deaths and punishment for completing game without dying(you will get only 1 achievement).

author: {'steamid': '76561198049196395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1475693763}
review: Great game for no cost. It suppose to be a horror game but it's not really horror even though death is around every corner. Even the trees can kill you. This game plays a lot more like those old school point and click games like King's Quest, Gabriel Knights or Phantasmagoria. It's text based so you do need to pay attention to what you are reading and doing. In this game you should save often because you will die and have to start over again. It's not bad for a free game, it's not really horror but it is fun. Try it, it's free. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197973230221', 'num_games_owned': 14323, 'num_reviews': 849, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1475651894}
review: A small visual novel with sure not the best graphics but lovely interesting style. I enjoy the game, it has so many endings 2 (1 good, 1 neutral) and many bad ending where you can die (i think at least 15 ways). The game is really tough to find your way trough and maybe you will need the amazing guide, but its worth, its a really interesting little story, how dangerous a world can be. Since its free i give for visual novel fans 75 % and for achievement hunters 93 %, for normal gamers 57 % to take a look. I would really want to support the developer and would pay even 1-1,5 euros for the game. Thx 4 reading.

review: to me this game is a 10 out 10. it was interesting reminded me of dungeon and dragons. the art is crude but beatiful at the same time. i got 70 percent of the achievements and beat the game after a short rest. i tried to look up how to get into the tower couldnt find any so i explored and the hints are subtle but well done. this game shouldnt be free tho i believe its a game worth 5 dollars yea the game is short about 3 to 4 hours but the fun and effort i put in to trying to defend my small shack and revenge my cows death it was all worth it. my only problem was the end where it says my journey isnt finish but then the game ends i wanted to explore the plagued city. other then that great game just remember this game was free and is worth your team and effort great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055363482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1475675767}
review: Very cool game! Being free, I had low expectations, but was happily suprised to discover that this is a fully developed indie, decision-making game. You're choices do matter, and you will likely attain most of the steam achievements before beating the game for the first time. Make sure to save occasionally, otherwise you'll have to go through the same gameplay, but you can quickly get through scenes and back to where you were if you do forget to save. The developer did an amazing job with this one! I play games a bit slower, and it only took me 1.5hrs to get all the achievements. I'd imagine most people could beat it in half that time. Definitely worth a playthrough.

review:
I'm a Chinese, so forgive me for my poor grammar and spelling.
81mins and I've finally found my way out.
This is a fascinating game as I rackon.
I've seen one of those who 'Not recommend' this game, the guy says, in two words: not logical. I think it is a bit like that,(but that is not the for the whole game, also not the fun part of it). It's really interesting making choises, and it's really interesting to make the choises and to pray and see what happends next.
The whole game is about gathering pieces of information and to link them in your mind. It's the fun part of most games and this one really did it well.
It's a game worth your time trying. And it's free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098466628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1475595975}
review:
√à un'avventura grafica dalla pessima componente narrativa. Il gioco si compone di lunghe descrizioni di sensazioni, che occupano gran parte delle sensazioni narrate. Lo sviluppatore avrebbe dovuto preferire creare immagini ed ambientazioni rialmente inquientati, piuttosto che tentare di suggerire al giocatore cosa provare. La serie di scelte che compone l'altra met√† del gameplay risulta davvero superficiale: ci si ritrova quasi in ogni caso a leggere profonde descrizioni del nostro battito cardiaco che si altera e di immagini che dovrebbero esserre inquietanti o a leggere di come siamo morti in modi patetici.
Purtroppo il gioco non da nulla di quello che lo sviluppatore si era messo in testa di trasmettere; un tentativo fallito.
Giocatelo per capire come non dovrebbe essere fatta un'avventura grafica. Non √® uno scherzo, lo consiglio sul serio: √® un esperimento fallito di un programmatore, dai suoi sbagli si pu√≤ imparare.
